description:
Amazing service! Came here the other day because I really wanted to try the smash burger and fries, and could not be more impressed.

This place reminds me of a Chick-fil-a version of McDonald's or some other burger place. I ordered a shake and was really impressed to get not only the shake in a nice glass but also a second glass of all the 'leftover shake' when they were mixing it.

Love the burger, love the food, will definitely be back for the service.
author: Andrew T.

description:
The line, was super slow. There was a guy just trying to use the coupon on his Smashburger app and something went wrong and the coupon voided? Instead of handling it on the side, the manager? Or whoever the guy was , took forever dealing with it holding up the rest of the line. Next time, consider doing triage on the side. 

The food was alright. Got the burger with the mushrooms. One step above a fast food burger, nothing more. 3/5

Skip on the pickle chips. Really salty and soggy! 1/5
author: J P.

description:
Mediocre at best. 

I would like to admit, I am sitting here intoxicated and I heard this place was bomb. Since I was in there area, I thought I would give it a go. For a fam of four, we paid a little more than $50 for burger and fries plus a kids meal. Legit, being that I have been drinking cause I just got out of the Rugby world championship, I would say, GO TO IN N OUT, go anywhere!! Jesus, I was so unimpressed and I was so excited to try their food that I think the disappointment hurt more than it should have.
author: Tracy S.

description:
The food was good enough and the staff was very friendly and did the best they could however they were immensely under staffed. Everyone around me at the other tables seemed to be bothered and complaining about the turnaround time with the orders. I enjoy smashburger but this location does the chain terribly. Again the workers were great and hustling and bustling just no way they could keep up with the quantity if customers while still providing high quality service. 

I'll continue to eat at smashburger but never again at this one.
author: Walt W.

description: They are slow as hell!! Geez. I should've went to McDonald's!! Great burgers but horrible service.
author: Jermaine J.

description: Oh how the mighty have fallen.  I went in today and it was tragic how bad this place is now.  20+ minute wait for food, incorrect order (other tables also experienced this), dirty dishes overflowing on most of the unoccupied tables, and now they will automatically charge you for the "big" burger unless you explicitly say you want the smaller / regular portion.
author: Meow S.

description: Buffalo burger should be avoided at all cost. Got a mushroom Swiss last visit and it was amazing. But after this experience not sure I will come back
author: Toby D.

description:
I won't be coming back. What you get is too little for what you pay, $7.89 + .67 tax, total $8.56. 

Pros
- The space was nice, clean, quiet and has a pleasant atmosphere with the pop music volume set low enough to bear. 
- The chicken burger was flavorful, albeit a little too salty. 
- The staff was friendly and attentive. 

Cons
- The burger was sloppily assembled and oily. 
- It was a very small burger, a 4 inch bun and 1/8 inch sliver off a chicken breasts. A perfect serving size for an 8 year old, maybe. It's was really more like a slider. 
- Lighting could be a little brighter - kind of romantic, though, or meditative. 
- AC kept the temperature on the cooler/cold side. 

Oh well, we live and learn.
author: Ed C.

description: pretty good burgers here nothing super special but the burgers are better than fast food burgers. Definitely better than burgers I make for myself as well. Fries are perfect and there is ample seating. They serve protein style which is nice and bring the food to you. Fan of the classic burger--the patty is well salted.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
It's a pretty decent place, but they make a lot of mistakes if you do the "Craft Your Own" burgers. I have been here a couple of times and each time they were incorrect with my order.

We were here last night and they got pretty much everything wrong...lol So if you are really picky about your burger, you may want to order something from their preset items.

I do like their food though. They have a variety of proteins to choose from and the prices are pretty reasonable. I especially like their fries. They are like a skinny, crunchier version of McD fries and their Smashfries (tossed in rosemary, garlic &olive oil) are delicious! The only problem is once you start eting them, you can't stop.

Both beef and turkey burgers are juicy and flavorful. If I'm in the area and nothing fancy my palate, I'd usually go here.
author: Alice L.

description: Tried them for the first time, yummy. I placed an order online in the am and my crispy chicken salad was ready as promised.  Fresh and hot!
author: Aj C.

description:
The burgers are fine, but the staff here is the reason for 1 star.    They are consistently rude and slow.    God forbid you have a special request -- they will make sure you know how much effort they are going through to help you.  

This attitude isn't isolated to just one employee or just one visit.   It comes from the manager at this store.  

Do yourself a favor and visit another Smashburger location
author: Kinson S.

description:
First time I got fast food in years... and it was almost exactly like I remember... disappointing.

The bf and I first got the idea to go here when he saw they had a BOGO deal and neither of us had ever been before. 

They're located upstairs in the top complex so we didn't immediately know where they were as they don't have a street level sign anywhere. 

Ordered the Sin City that has a fried egg on top, although I wished it was a soft yolk but I guess I can't expect that here lol. First off, their egg bun is really greasy- so greasy that whenever I'd set the burger down, I'd have to wipe all the excess grease off my hands... every single time. Gross. 

I do like that they offer sweet potato fries and salads as healthier options but they kind of mess that up when the fries are sitting in a pool of grease. Couldn't eat the bottom half cuz there was so much grease.

Whatever. It worked fine for the BOGO sale, I can mark it off that I tried it, but I'd never come and pay full price.
author: Mandi W.

description:
STAFF: friendly helpful and quick (kitchen staff main fat guy RUDE AF)
FOOD: done sloppy ( I gave me sweet potato fries instead of wedgy fries which was upsetting)
COST:$25
Over all review:  I would not ever eat here again I feel like the assistant manager that was on duty was a little rude along with the stick kitchen staff the main cook I would not recommend this place) I asked for fries not to be salty and the assistant manager goes to the cook like yeah she wants to change it she just came up to me now and wants to change it basically making me feel like I inconvenience but then when I am the customer I am the paying customer. Hey seriously need to get their act together this is the fattest food place get used to the constant changes of menus and orders never again will I step foot in this place
author: Lei S.

description:
Never been to a Smashburger, so had to try it.  Feels more like an In-N-Out than a Super Duper.  That is it's high quality fast food (e.g. In-N-Out) rather than slightly more refined "fast casual" (e.g. Super Duper).  Don't get me wrong, I'm totally loving it as a fast food burger contender.

Classic Smash: I'm a huge fan of the Maillard reaction, so can totally appreciate a burger patty that tries to maximize it.  It's  patty that is literally smashed so it has as much crispy surface areas as possible.  The umami crunchy goodness from the patty dominates the whole burger experience, in a good way.

Fried Pickles: These were great.  Not too much batter and not too little.  The pickles were nice and crisp, not limp and soggy.  A nice tartness in each bite to contrast the rich deep fried coating.  A creamy dipping sauce to add another flavor dimension.  The only complaint I'd have is that an order is way too big for one person.  The sodium heavy nature of the pickles makes it hard to get through more than half.  Kinda wish they offered a half-n-half with one of the deep fried potato options as the other half.
author: Adam B.

description:
Burger chains are a dime a dozen these days, and in my opinion Smashburger occupies a tenuous spot in the whole spectrum of them. It's a fast-casual place so is ostensibly slightly higher-end than In and Out, but in my opinion does not quite rise up to Five Guys or Super Duper levels of quality and scrumptiousness, even though it has a far larger menu.

I found the food at this location to be OK. The large BBQ bacon and cheddar was fairly priced given its size and quality. Tip: if you're hungry, go with a large instead of a regular. Meanwhile, the onion rings were OK, sort of like diner quality, and indeed the entire experience felt like diner fare dressed up in a standardized venue as opposed to a retro, independent one. Everything came out in a reasonable amount of time.

The manager on duty when I stopped by was exceptionally outgoing and courteous, checking in on folks to see how their meal was and offering promotional coupons for subsequent visits. Overall, a very decent visit.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch during my work break, but what I encountered was not quick at all!

Food: The burger was solid. Great quality angus beef, nicely toasted burger buns, an all around awesome burger. The milkshake was super creamy and thick- delicious. Basically drank it down in 30 seconds because it was so good.

Service: This place is basically an upscale fast food joint. However, the already limited service was incredibly disappointing. My burger took ages, and only after I was done and waiting around to head back to work did my milkshake finally come. They had to apologize because they forgot to bring it to me. With all the free time I had waiting for my food, I looked behind the counter and all the servers were just hanging out, drinking milkshakes, even though the place was fairly busy and many customers were being ignored. The only one who was working hard was my server, Sean. He was super friendly and apologized several times for my food being late, even though he was basically the only one running around and helping everybody.

Overall, the food was great but the amount of time I had to spend at a fast food joint was just not worth the trouble. I might return for take-out!
author: Hannah S.

description:
"Trung?" goes the guy at behind the front counter about to take my order..

OMG! LMFAO... despite never really ever being in this area, and pretty much the only time I came to this location, of the guys I met from the San Jose Coleman location works here. He had come down to San Jose for training for a week or so and being a regular, met him and got to know him for a bit. He was just as surprised to see me as I was.

Anyway, besides the obvious service being great and being recognized, the food and experience itself lends to be very pleasing. The fast-casual environment that Smashburger provides complements most people who are looking for a place to sit down and eat while still having something besides the cheaper, low quality fast food options.

Pricing is pretty ok, though might be high for some folks. The catch that gets you coming back are the coupons and rewards that you get. After your first time, you're pretty much set for all the following visits. It is why I am pretty much a regular at Smashburger (granted not at this location though). If you're in the area, then sure, check it out.
author: Trung N.

description: The perfect burger and cheaper than McDonalds everything is great and sometimes I get 10$ off best coupons ever just downloaded the app
author: Devonnie C.

description:
Came here for a quick lunch, since I was in the neighborhood. Got the turkey burger with avocado and swiss, and an order of veggie fries to be healthy. 

Overall it was good. Just a bit overpriced for what you got. But if you are in the area, not a bad option for a good, quick bite.
author: Sonia A.

description:
My husband and I indulge at smashburger at least once a week! Well, I take that back. We use to be weekly patrons. The workers are super nice especially Jaime. He knows our name and recognizes us. However, there is a Filipino girl that seems to always be groaning. My to-go order was wrong a few times, so my husband suggest to check the burgers before we leave. I always order a burger with BBQ sauce. It even says it on the receipt. I told the girl who took our order that I ordered a burger with BBQ sauce but the cooks forgot to add it. She looked at me like I was being difficult. I even said a side of BBQ will do, they don't have to make me another one. I was very polite about it since we do go there weekly, but she decided to huff and puff and walked a few steps to get me my BBQ sauce on the side.  

The burgers are good when made correctly. We always get a create your own. But with that kind of attitude I rather take my money and spend it at Togos which is a couple doors away or even McDonalds that's across the street. Customers that is willing to do business with you is actually keeping your ass employed. No customers = No Money = No paycheck. So before you want to throw someone attitude when it's not even their fault, think about if you really need a job. This wouldn't be a big deal, but this happened more than once!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Really tasty food. i love that they have brussel sprouts if you don't want to eat fries. 

For the love of god, though. they cannot get an order right. You have to check multiple times on the order, if you are getting it for take out check your order before leaving the store. Typically 2-3 things will be wrong. I told the girl at the register 3 times that I wanted 2 orders of fried pickles, of course when I got home there was only one order on the receipt and in the bag!

They have two older gentlemen running the food, they are really sweet and nice and on top of it. The people working the register are out to lunch though.
author: ellen c.

description: It's just a very disorganized place. The food is ok, but the service is a circus of failure. To go orders sit on the kitchen counter for forever being seemingly invisible, this confuses the kitchen staff as much as it confuses me. The waitresses will pass by it multiple times, look directly at it, then proceed to sweep the floor and/or unpack some spoons instead of giving it to you. Save yourself some time and just go get it. Ordering is almost as successful of an experience.
author: Chris B.

description:
Ordered a "lettuce wrap" burger with blue cheese and sautéed mushrooms. 

The "lettuce wrap" wasn't really a wrap- it was two pieces of green leaf lettuce and a turkey patty smacked right in between. Everything pretty much fell out and I resorted to eating this thing like a salad.

The extra $1.39 and $.70 cents I paid for mushrooms and blue cheese was appalling. I couldn't even count this in MyFitnessPal; that's how minimal of a portion size I got for these two add-ons. One would expect a decent serving size of cheese and mushrooms. Instead I got 4 slices of canned mushrooms and 1/8 tsp of cheese.
author: Angel F.

description:
Smash burger has me all the way fu**ed up. I essentially wasted a bunch of time before throwing $25 in the toilet. I got a regular sized Club smash burger with sweet potato "smash fries". Smash fries are just regular french fries that are tossed in olive oil and Rosemary. Tip: don't order things that are fried and then tossed in oil -_-  I really didn't like the rosemary flavor  & these fries were just dripping in oil, it was REALLY unappetizing. I didn't finish the fries because they were really grossing me out, and the words "I didn't finish the fries" has never before been uttered from my mouth so....

The burger was just OK. The meat was flavorful and crusty, the way you'd dream a smash burger to be. But the couple thin slices of brown avocado hurt my feelings and the greasy fast food style bacon left a lot to be desired. 

So then I ordered another burger  the truffle mushroom chicken was HELLA good. But so tiny guys srsly wtf. This burger was 3 bites, literally less substantial than a McD's cheeseburger. The regular smash fries (don't ask how I know this) were less gross than the sweet potato ones, but EVEN GREASIER and still gross and the portion was less than half the amount served with the sweet p'tates.  So all kinds of fries were left behind, never thought I'd see the day.  So I'm driving home and all the sudden I just feel super green. Good news is that I didn't throw up. Yet. But I'm positive I will before the night is over and that's why I should have just thrown my $25 in the toilet and saved myself some time.  

So, probably the better idea is to order the large size burger instead of being like me ordering a regular size burger and then realizing it's not enough food. I can't attest to whether a large burger would be enough but this place is super overpriced and it was annoying to me to see things like digital menu screens when they should be saving their money on those frills and offering bigger portions. I came in here at 7 o'clock, peak dinnertime hour, and the place was completely empty. 

I also didn't like how I could see the cashier pre-scooping the metal milkshake containers full of ice cream and then putting them back in the freezer to wait for somebody to order one. It takes five seconds to put ice cream in a cup so why would you pre-scoop it and then just let it sit in the freezer to get freezer burn? She was making like six or seven of them & the place was totally empty. I noticed that she was weighing the ice cream, so I imagine that's why she was doing them ahead of time, so that her stingy boss doesn't get mad at her for putting a teaspoon too much ice cream in somebody's milkshake. Smash burger: that's a bad idea, don't do that anymore. 

Another thing: this cashier was handling money and then scooping ice cream with no gloves on and she also had her long curly hair in kind of a wild ponytail and when she would lean over to scoop the ice cream, her ponytail would slide off her shoulder and into the freezer. This is why you shouldn't have people who are trained to be cashiers handling food.

Okbai.
author: Emma H.

description:
Smashburger is a level higher up than your regular fast food burger chains. It's fancy enough to warrant a higher burger price value at $6-8 tier range. Good location since it's within the Potrero Center so there's a convenient parking lot available. Very clean interior space and it reminds me a bit of a Shake Shack. Definitely check this place out especially when they're offering BOGO promos.

SMASHFRIES
Basically super thin shoestring fries. Delicious with the herbs dusted on top but extremely oily and greasy. The highlight really is the ketchup because I noticed that it tasted slightly sweeter than the regular Heinz ketchup and then I checked the bottle at the table and saw that their ketchup was made specially for Smashburger. I actually like their secret brand of ketchup more so than regular ketchup. 

SPICY JALAPENO BAJA 
Burger presentation is pretty fancy as you get it in a metal tray basket lined with their Smashburger wrapping paper. The burger comes in two halves so you have to do the "smashing" of the burger yourself. Beef patty is flavorful and grilled nicely. I wish it had more guacamole on top though. I ordered a big size and was surprised that it came out looking like a regular size burger. It was the perfect size for me though so I'm kinda wondering how small their small might be.

They have Haagen Daaz ice cream shakes that look pretty good served in a sundae cup. I need to come back and try their shakes one day. And if you're less inclined to have a burger, they also have salads!
author: Diana C.

description: Walked out because the manager was yelling very loudly at kitchen staff. He was extremely rude and unprofessional. He was screaming and belittling staff in front of customers. Sadly this isn't the first time I've seen this happen at a Smashburger.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Black bean veggie option, was ehh... their shakes are good though, worth the trip alone. 

My friends who eat meat all said they loved it .
author: Rio J.

description:
Burger is fine, but the menu is confusing and the service is poor. I asked what the difference between classic and regular was, and she said, "Once again, the regular is a five ounce and the large is a six ounce". 

I came here about 2 years ago, and the place has just gone down hill from there. It's more expensive than McDonald's, and food comes out extremely slowly.
author: Sheewon B.

description:
Ordered a grilled cheese combo to go. Got home and found a cheese burger with fries all over the place and not 1 fry in its container.


Luckily I am not a vegetarian. 

Took a LONG time for them to make this too with only 3 other customers waiting.
author: Jenn T.

description: This place is amazing! Always have great food!!!! Servers are helpful and courteous. Today's on duty MANAGER IS AN ABSOLUTE A**HOLE!!! Sat on his a** in a booth for 30 minutes shouting orders at the staff, telling people to get off the clock and telling them to work faster. 6 customers in line and still just sat there. Then FINALLY stood up l, still yelling, and began to pick up orders. Upon one guest asking if he could get his to go order that was ready in the window, manager rudely snickered "well did you pay for it?" And then finally handed it to him. I've never seen this manager before usually is a nicer one. Won't be back if this is the shift that this restaurant is taken
author: Nicole B.

description:
Been to the Smashburger Sacramento and enjoyed my time, experienced this one and unfortunately had a terrible experience. Our food was picked up by an older gentlemen before we were finished. My sister got a cheeseburger and the cheese wasn't melted, the bathroom smells like a homeless man. 
The best part was that it was picture worthy food, and the fries were fried. #smashburgersf
author: Joeline C.

description: First time trying smash burger, got the pub burger. Good price, very flavorful & cooked to my liking....just really oily. Amazingly impressive customer service!!
author: Dav K.

description: Today was my first time eating here, and I must say that the food looks great. I ordered the Jalapeño burger meal with sweet potatoe por and it was really good.  The place was clean, and the staff was friendly courteous.
author: Denis R.

description: Smaaaaaaaash beeeeeegers is the place to b egg fong and chef I'm getting off late I'm gay I think I need to pee
author: Oso O.

description: So I had never been to a smash burger before today! Everything was perfect! The burger was delicious. I had the triple double pub burger for $4, which I think is an amazing deal! Didn't even break $5 after tax. My only complaint was that the burger was too either... oily or just wet somehow. Maybe the from the onions? The customer service was amazing! The manager and the staff seemed to have a good relationship which is always nice to see. The manager also actually helped out! He went to the tables and made sure thing everything was good and he even helped me when I couldn't figure out what to get. 10/10 would recommend!
author: Krista C.

description:
This is my first time trying this place.

The assistant manager is a complete rude a-hole.  The rest of the staff were nice.

The burger was mediocre at best. McDonalds is better.  The burger was sloppy and wasn't very appealing.  The tater tots were good.

Never will I eat here again.
author: Seth T.

description: Gave my order to another person. Wait another 20 min after a 20 min wait. Smh my whole lunch hour was spent waiting for my burger. Had I not asked about my order i would have waited another 20. Not a happy experience!
author: Nessa M.

description:
I was given a gift card from one of my colleagues, it was not one of the regular burger spots I have ever tried so I figured why not try it out.

I was able to sample there own original smash burger and the bbq bacon and cheddar burger. The patty was smashed I guess thats why it is named smash burger, I believe this place is a chain, read few of the reviews didn't expect much going in. So let me break down everything, the food, the restaurant, the service.

The food, 2 burgers, the original smash burger served with smashed 6oz or 8oz patty with red onions, tomatoes, lettuce and slightly toasted bun, add your own condiments, grade B- despite it being oily, the burger was good, good meat to bun ratio, not super heavy almost light burger again minus the dripping oil from the burger. The BBQ Bacon & cheddar burger, if you have had carls jr big western, this is the same exact thing, only difference instead of onion rings here it is lightly battered onion strings, the bbq sauce is prominent on every bite 6oz or 8oz is offered cheddar slice is heavy, even ordering an 8oz barely tasted the meat grade for this burger C, copy cat burger, oily, could not taste the meat even though it was an 8oz. The fries offered are the regular thin cut type fries deep fried and seasoned with salt lightly, the other is the smash fries, garnished with olive oil, diced garlic and rosemary; splurge on the smash fries, the vanilla shake was heavenly, heavy froffy, delicious so bad for diabetics haha if you can sample their shakes

The location is in the protrero area in the city, odd choice for a burger spot but I guess it works since the next closest location is in Alameda, very clean inside, very polite staff. Parking I believe during work week is a nightmare, only assuming because during a holiday week it was still packed unless you park by petco on the opposite side of parking lot

This spot for burgers is ok, nothing super fancy, just decent made burgers

Food *** burgers are meh, vanilla shake is must try, the smash fries I recommend over the regular
Price $$
Service **** helpful and pleasant staff
Ambiance **** clean, open, high ceilings, uniformed tables and chairs
author: Clarence A.

description: Sean (the assistant manager) completed a door dash order instead of taking my order. He was passive aggressive, loud and awkward. He also talked to his nice staff this way too. He yelled Linda's name and ordered her around like she was his pet. (Linda is a nice looking old lady who runs the food to the customers) This shouldn't be the case at such an easy to run place like a smash burger. I'm disgusted at the customer service here.
author: Mike G.

description: One of the worst burgers I have ever been served. Both patties burnt into charcoal mini discs. These were the smallest little burger patties I have ever seen.
author: INTHECITY S.

description:
First time here. Lady at the cashier was really nice and helpful! Ordered three burgers, two smash fries, one regular fry, and a salted Carmel milk shake. 
Shake had the consistency of water or should I say milk. I asked them to make it again only for it to be the same. So I went to the nice lady at the cashier and told her about it and she said she would make it herself. It was better. We waiting so long for our food. We order cheese on our buglers but two came out without it. Food was ok. Not worth the price I paid and I won't be back, ever.
author: Brandie G.

description:
I can not believe I haven't heard about this gem shower.  It took my 13 year old son to mention a location in Sacramento, to have my first "Smashing Experience" (TM).  

The meat (beef or chicken) explodes with flavor.  Nothing is pyre-made; i me. I.e. a all made to order, do everything is piping hot.

Great place.  Now, I drive across San Francisco to get my almost daily fix!!!!
author: Randall S. B.

description:
In the area looking for a place for a takeout lunch, I remember attending a YEE at a Smashburger at the 16th & Potrero shopping center. Though it's a large complex with a large parking lot, this lot was crowded. 

There wasn't a line and I was able to walk right up to the counter and place my order.  Within 10 minutes, my order was ready.  

Sin City Burger - haystack onions, Applewood bacon, fried egg, cheese, Smashburger sauce (mayo, mustard and relish blend) on an Egg bun. This was a limited time burger but it is off-menu now.  My favorite Smashburger.

Sweet potato fries. 

Got my burger and fries.  I was happy.
author: Al L.

description: Visited this place many times, quality wise is very good place. This particular review is about my current visit 04/06. Food was ade to perfection but store was not clean at all. Store management need to pay attention to cleanliness of this place...
author: Jagmit S.

description: Very clean and great food. HOWEVER, the assistant manager is rude. That kind of misogyny may be accepted in other cities, but it will not fly in SF. I obviously don't know the whole story, but fighting with your staff directly in front of the customers does not bode well with me. Additionally, shaming my bf for not paying for my meal is unnecessary.
author: Savvy P.

description:
TLDR: Taste good, don't customize or be prepared to wait. Service was aight.

Came here Sunday afternoon and place was empty. I got the Avocado Club with fried chicken $7 and a Large Smash Fries $4. My order came pretty quickly. Smash fries were goooddd but the extra olive oil made it really greasy. The fried chicken sandwich tasted great. It's like an expensive McChicken to be honest haha.

Story time: My cousin ordered a BBQ Bacon & Cheddar burger but subbed cheddar with pepper jack. Her order took super long (were they buying the cheese?!). When it arrived, there was no bacon or onion. Now, how are you going to give a burger WITH NO BACON? BLASPHEMY. So she went and told them. They took over 20 minutes to remake the burger (why couldn't you just slap 2 pieces of bacon and call it a day? Were they getting that bacon fresh from the pig?!). When it finally returned, everything BUT the pepper jack cheese was on there. By this time, she just gave up and ate. Just terrible.
author: Benita M.

description: I visited again and I'm convinced this is the best it gets as far as fast-food dine in experiences go, which makes it worthy of 5 stars - exceptional for the class of establishment it's in. I actually had a beef burger this time, great flavorful taste owning to the extra browning of the smashed meat and fresh ingredients. The ordering process was efficient. The service is astonishingly great. Linda the cashier happily took my order, informed me of the 20th Anniversary special, and brought my food to my seat. She also checked in on other patrons and goes above and beyond.
author: Truc N.

description: I agree getting your order right happens every other time but the freshness and the flavor of the food along with the great personality of the Store Manager Tom makes this my last minute go to. I don't eat meat so I love how they can make any burger style with a black bean patty. Yes lol it came with bacon that I had to take off, but still a good spot.
author: Vonny K.

description:
Love the burgers. But probably the most disorganized burger joint ever. 

On several occasions I've waited beyond 20 minutes for a couple burgers. Tonight it's been 25 minutes already and no sign of burgers yet.

Kind of absurd. Not a review I'm pleased to have to write. 

Get it together please, for your business' sake, if not for your customers' sake.
author: Rob G.

description:
"Can I get a triple double?"
"Sure! ... By the way, there's a 15-20 minute wait right now"
"Did you say 20 minutes??"
"Yes... we just got a big order"

Wtf... who waits for 20 minutes for a single burger?? I could get a burger faster than that at a restaurant and this is supposed to be a **fast** food place...

I don't know what's up with the "fast" food joints in this strip mall, but they are decidedly not fast...
author: Anton G.

description: I hate this place but my son likes their burgers.  Way over priced.   They're rude and often get my order wrong but the little Asian lady is nice.  I often receive regular fries although I order smash fries. The older guy who acts like the owner or the manager is rude af.  I wish there was a in n out close by.
author: Urban E.

description: If you've never had the spicy jalapeno Baja with the Chipotle bun from Smashburger then you are definitely missing out. They fill it with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, guacamole, jalapenos and their specialty Smashburger. It is gorgeous to look at and taste even better. The prices at Smashburger are on the extravagant side so beware of that. The burgers here are definitely delicious. They are slightly small and it would be better to get two. See you again soon Smashburger!
author: Estela C.

description:
I wasn't planning on eating here but I skipped breakfast and was starting to get hangry. After finish up my shopping at Ross, I smell a savory oniony smell as I'm walking back to my motorcycle. I look around to see where the smell is coming from and realize there's a Smashburger. I had heard about this chain from my sister in law, because that's where her three kids always want to go for burgers. I figured I would try it. 

I was surprised by how few people were there for 11:30am but it's not exactly a high profile location. The inside was clean. The service at the counter was prompt and friendly. My burger came out fast and they brought it to my table. The 6oz. Colorado Burger was all I ordered, but it was pretty dang tasty. It's a limited time item which is why I tried it. So glad I did. It was a topping-loaded, cheesy meatball of flavor, with a spicy kick. The manager came over to see how my food was and gave me a coupon for a free side with my next order.

I would definitely recommend the Colorado burger. Even though my bill was $8 for just the one 6oz burger, I left satisfied. Although it was my first meal of the day so I fill up easy. If you have a hearty appetite you should go with the 8oz.
author: Izzy Z.

description: 5 stars for Thomas.  Came here on a Friday night around 9pm. They were short staffed. Thomas was manning the whole front end...taking orders, making shakes, delivering the food to the tables and all with a smile on his face. Super nice guy.  Oh and the burgers and fries are good too.  Get the smash fries.
author: David S.

description: Pretty good! The place is located right in the Potrero Center (go in the parking lot, not on the street as Google Maps says). Parking was ample on a Saturday and the place is clean. Service is fast and there is plenty of seating. Overall I enjoyed my burger (came in with w B1G1 free offer). The standard prices listed were higher than I usually do for a burger (though with the offer was quite cheap). Manager was friendly and conversant. Overall a solid local burger joint (especially compared with the janky McDonalds across the street).
author: Mikey J.

description: Terrible service.  Website for orders is down. So I call, and they say they won't take a phone order.  Go someplace else, where they give a darn about their customers.
author: Bryan H.

description: Very inconsistent with their service. They always get my order wrong and the portion of fries is terrible. As the cook brought out food he was getting every order wrong. Just waiting for our food, 4 in a row was wrong. Ever since this place opened its been like this. Corporate needs to do something about this place
author: Brian F.

description:
There's definitely parking available but scattered around the plaza.  Just a warning, the bottom floor smells like pee a bit.

I've ordered online quite a bit from this place and they usually get it wrong somehow...so I've decided to order in person after a few mishaps and they get it right each time I've ordered in person.  The food is usually pretty good compared to other fast food places like Mcdonald's and BK.  I usually order the burgers here and it tastes a bit more upscale. I usually get the big patties and it seems like they smash the meat patties more so it looks bigger. The burgers doesn't taste like dry meat with a wad full of condiments and that feels refreshing compared to the other fast food joints I'm used to eating at.

A bit of a drive with traffic, but definitely worth going to for better fast food.
author: Eric T.

description: I was in the area and pretty hungry so stopped in for a quick bite. The classic turkey burger was much too salty. The fried pickles were also severely over salted and very greasy. I wanted to like this place, but for half the price I can get a tastier meal at Jack in the Box. There was also only one cashier on when I visited at 6pm on a Sunday. Each transaction took about 3 minutes, so with 3 people in front of me I waited almost 10min to order then another 10 to get my food. Behind me was a line of about 6 people. There should have been a second cashier for sure. I won't be back.
author: Tanya K.

description: This place is weak AF and expensive AF the bun they use is super low quality.. I make a better burger
author: Gerardo R.

description:
I didn't realize it's been six months since I've been here the prices went up but the food is really good. now you have 2 size fries small or large yes of course well might as mk it a Large!  Ahahaha! 
The service was really good the chicken was done the way i lik it.....
Hot fresh and fast to you and they come ck see how was everything. 
Well be bk sooner then 6 months. LOL! 
If you give them an email on your birthday you get a free milkshake you don't even have to purchase anything you just want to come and get a dessert or whatever you prefer..
author: Lizzie G.

description: I got 2 classic smashburgers, chicken and beef, a regular fried and a regular soda for $22!!!! Very expensive and the burgers are small
author: Irfan M.

description: STAY AWAY FROM HERE!!!! Unless you want to wait for about an hour or a day for your food! They are not organized at all here. Don't know what's going on in the kitchen? While we were waiting for our order amongst with everyone else waiting others were getting other people's orders. This location needs to get it together!! Corporate needs to restructure!!
author: Sandra S.

description: The taste is good I wish they fries was a lil bigger but they good my burger was ok I got the avocado chicken grilled with ranch bacon grilled onions and lettuce i said no tomatoes but they put them on there anyway I asked for it to be cut in half NOPE and got the wrong bun whole wheat but hey guess I needed the whole wheat bun besides that food was good just wish they actually read the online order and not throw anything together
author: Johnika J.

description: Moved to the area last year, and was sent a neighborhood flyer regarding their location so thought I'd give it a try. Annnddd I'm really glad I did! I ordered the Spicy Jalapeño Baja burger with a side of Smashfries, Coca Cola, and chocolate milkshake (#dontjudge, this girl can eat lol), and was in a severe food coma after consumption. This little gem is underrated, and super delicious! It also helps that the restaurant is kept very clean and the customer service was excellent.
author: Mona M.

description:
Normally I don't rate fast food chains because I pooh-pooh them. Oh wait, here I go... "Pooh-pooh!" There, I feel better now. I am, however, willing to take exception for Smashburger because I frankly never heard of them before they decided to take over the old Blockbuster Video space at the Potrero Center where I go to the Safeway anyway. I go to I Luv Sushi & Teriyaki, too, so I'm no food snob, y'see. And besides, Jamie W. misses going to Wendy's when there used to be more of them in the city. So I'll just keep my 'pooh-pooh' to myself in the privacy of my home where I can roll my eyeballs as much as I want.

We came here one Sunday evening when we needed a burger fix and was surprised how empty it was. There are all sorts of instructions on the wall that you're supposed to follow. But we're guys so... I just went up and kept looking at the overhead menu until I was ready to order as the cashier heaved a series of sighs to hurry me along. I went for the $7.39 Bay Big Smashburger with Truffle Mushrooms and Swiss Cheese along with an order of their Smashfries and a 22-ounce Diet Coke. It added up to a bit short of $13. The burger was a wide, flat patty, rather greasy as the cheese was epoxied to it with the mushrooms melted into the cheese (photo: http://bit.ly/1wT8Mgj).

It was OK but nothing that would worry In-n-Out in my book. The Smashfries were strangely thin like potato sticks but flimsier and greasier with a bit of seasoning on them (photo: http://bit.ly/1tS487g). I frankly think I would have preferred some White Castle krinkle fries instead because I like the bulk. Jamie did a switcheroo on me and went for a Spicy Baja Jalapeño Smashchicken. Whatevs. So we came back just recently feeling like I should eat a little lighter. Where else should I go but Smashburger? Am I right or what? This time I ordered the $5.99 Baja Cobb Salad with fresh greens, sharp cheddar cheese, crispy Applewood smoked bacon, tomatoes, onions and quite inexplicably, a fried egg.

Without knowing the egg was coming, I also requested the Grilled Chicken for $2 extra. It was all excessively covered in a spicy chipotle dressing, and the mix of egg and smashed chicken was too much for me (photo: http://bit.ly/1yr1mmb). I hate having the parent-child poultry together if you know what I'm saying. I skipped the Smashfries this time in favor of the $2.99 Veggie Frites, which are green beans and thickly julienned carrots combined together and flash-fried (photo: http://bit.ly/1CPYzYI). Oily, very oily. Nice attempts at some different things you wouldn't expect from a fast-food chain, but it just didn't quite come together for me.

FOOD - 3 stars...the burger isn't bad but kinda greasy and overpriced, the salad's a  better deal but a bit overdressed...they do give you plenty of choices
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...fairly spacious for a fast-food space and never that crowded when we're there
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...a weak area but it is a franchise after all
TOTAL - 3 stars...fast food joint with bigger aspirations but still middling in execution
author: Ed U.

description: Smash is one of my favorite fast food places to get a burger. I love their buns as well as the fact that you can swipe your own card for your purchase. Your order is listed on the screen right in front of you so you can't say you didn't know what you were ordering...maybe you just weren't paying attention. This location closes at 10p but the staff is just as friendly at 9:45p as they are at 1pm. Their burgers have gotten smaller since I first began coming but the price is still the same lol. I also love that they have someone bring your order to you whether you are dining in or having take-out. Tom has been there since I can remember and is always pleasant. Because my friend and I have unique names he may butcher them but we know that he means well.
author: Itika D.

description:
Between The Habit, Five Guys, and now Smashburger, trendy burger joints are quickly becoming the norm. 

However, I'm not a big fan of the ol' Smash. My order took me a good 30 minutes to get, and the burger was all grisly and burnt. Fries were super oily and greasy too.

I probably won't be back.
author: Casey S.

description: Food is delicious, service is poor. They brought my wife her shake but just forgot her burger. The waitress gave her attitude when reminded of it. Uh, San Francisco minimum wage is too high, evidently.
author: jones z.

description:
The 4 stars are for the good customer service the employees here give and of course the food too. 

I would love to give this place 5 stars, but I have 1 thing and 1 thing only that's keeping me from doing so. The manager here which is the heavier weight Caucasian guy is very rude to his employees. My bf and I come here very often and we've witnessed this guy be rude to his employees in front of all the customers more than twice. He does his managing loudly and rudely. This is probably why they always have new employees. He is not professional at all!! Go in the back office and discuss things STOP EMBARRASSING YOUR EMPLOYEES IN FRONT OF PEOPLE.!! These employees are great and do not deserve to be treated badly.
author: Reca A.

description:
With a recommendation from a trusted co-worker, we were off to the Potrero Center in search for a burger. For years I've driven past their location in Novato but never had the opportunity of trying their food until today. Smashburger is a fast-casual eatery, similar to Five Guys or Chipotle. As I walked in, you're instructed to grab a menu as you make your way to the front counter. Even with 5 of 6 customers in front of us, the line moved rapidly giving me just enough time to look over the menu. 

The menu is broken into two main sections: burgers or "smashburgers" and chicken sandwiches, appropriately called "smashchicken". Whether you're in the mood for beef or poultry, you have plenty to choose from with roughly 7 or so sandwiches to choose from or you can create your own. Additionally fresh salads and a kids menu are also offered. A variety of french fries are offered from traditional to spicy, as well as onion rings, fried pickles, or a side salad. Of course a burger shack isn't complete until shakes and malts are involved.

I settled on ordering the Spicy Jalapeno Baja grilled chicken sandwich. The toppings sounded too goo to pass up: guacamole, pepper jack, lettuce, tomato, onion & chipotle mayo on a spicy chipotle bun. The sandwich was priced at a more than reasonable $7.29, which led me to add a side salad for only $2.99. After placing your order, you're given a number and can seat yourself anywhere.

Less than 10 minutes later, my order was delivered to my table. The tray of food not only looked great but healthy and fresh. I was a little perplexed because the chicken was paper thin, making me think it was an egg, but after looking at it closely, it was the all-white grilled chicken. I took a few bites of the sandwich without altering the taste with any sauce or condiments and it was downright tasty. The baja flavors really worked well and had plenty of heat with the jalapenos and chipotl mayo. I added a bit of yellow mustard and it was a surprisingly tasteful sandwich packing plenty of flavor.

I ordered my side salad with their house vinaigrette which was better than most placed. Sure, the fries my co-worker was enjoying looked better than my rabbit food, but maybe next time. All in all, the side salad was a perfect combo to the otherwise healthy lunch. Once I had finished my meal, I was satisfied; was I stuffed? No. But it was just the right amount. Overall, not only was I impressed with the quality of food Smashburger delivered but also the value in an otherwise pricey city.

Ambiance/Decor: 4/5
Food: 4/5 
Service: 4/5
Price: $
Overall: 4/5

Pros:
+ Beef or Chicken, your choice smashburger
+ 7 or so specialty smashburgers 
+ Salads, fries and sides also available
+ Fast, fresh and tasty food
+ Reasonably priced ($11 for a chicken smashchicken and side salad)
+ Fast and friendly service
+ Local beers available
+ Ability to order online for pickup

Cons:
- Chicken was a little on the skinny side, beef it up!
author: Alexander E.

description:
I usually come here when I have a Buy One Get One Free coupon. That is an amazing deal that can be found online.  Just print it and you're good to go. 

What I have ordered:
Spicy Jalapeno Baja - Chipotle mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion, guacamole, fresh jalapenos and pepper jack cheese on a chipotle bun... If you like spicy, this is the burger to order. This is also my favorite burger :)

Truffle Mushroom Swiss - Truffle mayo, sauteed crimini mushrooms, aged swiss on an egg bun... you can barely taste the truffle mayo 

Sweet Potato Fries - Lightly salted and crispy to its perfection!

You can also make your own, the options are endless...
author: Ellen Z.

description:
First time visit here today, ordered a regular classic beef burger, tastes really good! The french fries are too thin though. 
A friend ordered a pepper jack burger but when the burger came, it had nothing but a cheese and the beef, so she asked for an exchange, and waited so long for the second burger and when the burger came, it was still not a pepper jack burger. The kitchen staffs were so careless -____-

Giving 4 stars is because my regular classic tastes really good, haha.
author: Kukumalu M.

description:
Nice spot for a burger joint at Potrero Center and with Smash Burger here, this place is definitely worth a visit for a quick lunch.

French Fries and Strawberry Milkshake are delicious, it definitely is a good combo.

*French Fries are thinly cut and tossed, plus it's very crispy and delicious
*Strawberry Milkshake is made hand spun with Haagen Dazs Ice Cream

My food was brought to me in less than 20 minutes. Most importantly, service is very good and the staff members are friendly. They demonstrated a very professional attitude which is also a good thing. This restaurant facility looks very clean! The salt, pepper, mustard, ketchup and napkins were placed neatly in a rack on each table. It wasn't super busy when I came in earlier and there were seats available so that's always a good thing. Overall, positive first experience here so I'm definitely coming in again.
author: Bennett W.

description:
This is hands down my favorite burger restaurant anytime I'm craving a burger.  I've visited this location over 20 times and it never lets me down.

The Sin City burger is my goto burger, it's juicy and delicious, I love the egg buns that it's served with.

Great service, great people, the manager Tom is a cool dude.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I was a little skeptical with Smashburger at first. However, I was able to enjoy a few Smashburger gift cards given to me for my birthday. This allowed me to give the place a fair shot at the competition. I've been here several times so I'm going to condense my experiences into one review.

I have tried several of their burgers, notably the Truffle Mayo Smashburger, Classic Smashburger, Avocado Chicken Club (crispy), and the Smashchicken Spicy Jalapeno Baja burger. They advertise a gourmet burger and are higher end compared to most fast food restaurants. They make the chicken super crispy which is a reason why I like it so much. It's probably slightly healthier too but that's debatable... Definitely get Smashfries with that. They are drizzled with olive oil and garlic! The potatoes are sliced super thin (almost like a shoestring). You'll also need to wash that down with something cold. Get a vanilla shake with that and you'll be leaving in a wheel barrow. The shake is delicious with whipped cream on top. Do it. Thank me later.

Bless the workers that put up with indecisive people. I was literally next in line but the large group people in front of me spent 10 minutes trying to get an order right. It was the worst experience ever... It also didn't help they all paid separately. The restaurant feels more like a sit down restaurant than it does fast food chain. The service is good too. I have been checked on more than once to make sure everything was good.
author: Tim G.

description:
Burger is good - but small. I asked for avocado and was given and 1/8 of one. No peppers... no to go
Cups...  no explanation why my order was brought 10 minutes later than the previous item. Second time visiting and continue to not have a great experience. In and out is still better.
author: Rick B.

description: Ok sort of bad service today.. No line but cashier wasn't there to take my order.. My baby running around.. I had to ask to take my order.. N ask for help for high chair.. N no one get for me !!! Turn around to fill my drink n my number was taken from table..!!! Wow ... Another jus standing by heat lamp waiting for food to come out... Really ???? I come cuz it's easy parking !!! Maybe I will stop coming here ...
author: Crisy G.

description:
They take a seasoned patty and smash on grill which is where the amen comes from . 

Get a double bacon cheese burger large patty grilled Jalapeños .

There is a short little black haired pretty girl slim frame and petite ... Works nights ... Was very rude even my friend noticed ... Just couldn't of been more annoyed we were there . 

Like she was doin us a favor taking our order.... Rolled eyes and said can't you read menu ...

I accidentally put the smallest drip of Vitamin water in water cup and after buying $30.00 worth of food and tipping she rudely stated that was for water only like I did it on purpose...

Please have her go work somewhere else or get proper customer service training or human decency trainin
author: Thomas D.

description:
I was excited to discover that there was a Smashburger in San Francisco. I lived in Denver several years ago, and there was a Smashburger by my office -- I went frequently for lunch and have nothing but fond memories of how high quality and delicious the food was.

My recent experience at the San Francisco Smashburger proved otherwise; my burger and haystack onions arrived *barely* warm, if even hot at all. It was obvious that it had been sitting under a heat lamp for more than 10 minutes as the oil on the burgers had started to curdle and congeal. The haystack onions were far too salty, and again, were at room temperature. The meal I had there lacked the freshness and flavors that I fondly remember from my Denver days. I ate half the burger and only managed a couple of onion rings before I pushed the entire thing away from me. What a waste of food and money.

To top it all off, I'm pretty sure that the poor quality of food was a direct result of our less than stellar customer experience. Although the restaurant was empty, and the person working the register was experiencing issues with entering our order. He tried to enter it multiple times, and we were stuck having to give our order over and over again. During that time, however, it appeared that our first order had registered after all, but proceeded to sit under the heat lamp for a good 10-15 minutes until our register had officially gone through. 

Adding insult to injury, the ladies bathroom was filthy; one toilet was clogged with poop. 

I'm extremely disappointed in my experience. I've been such a big fan of Smashburger for so long, and was one of the chain's largest advocates, telling my friends that it was far superior to other beloved chains like In N Out and Five Guys. Guess I was wrong, because I've never had the terrible meal and experience that I had at Smashburger at either of those places.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Mmmmm I ordered the Truffle Mushroom Swiss and it was soooo delicious! The burger is so juicy/flavorful and the mushrooms were succulently satisfying! 
I ordered a large burger which I finished but couldn't finish my large fries. I also ordered a chocolate shake that cured my sweet tooth and shared a sprite with my daughter to clear my palate. 
Im making this my new burger place!
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
I love there mushroom burger.. super yummy. And there patty is very jucy. 

Clean and good service place.
author: sean c.

description:
When I first saw SmashBurger, I thought they were having an identity crisis. The word "smash" had me thinking this place was a gym. But "burger" clearly implies this place serves food. And to top it off, the font reminds me of GameStop.

At any place that specializes in burgers, I always order a beef patty burger. (Chicken burgers and salads? No thank you.) So far, I've tried the avocado bacon burger, truffle mushroom swiss burger, and BBQ bacon cheddar burger. All of them were very filling, but very greasy and heavy. The avocado was a skimpy portion, and the truffle-infused mayo was very strong and pungent. The meat patty was cooked medium-well to well-done, but it's unmemorable and not very juicy.

The sweet potato fries were very fresh and crispy, but lacked flavor. However, I do like the smashfries, which is thin-cut fries tossed with olive oil, garlic, and rosemary. It's very flavorful and delicious. Incorporate herbs into fries and I'm sold!

SmashBurger is a huge step up from McDonald's across the street, but still not worth going across the city for. I do like how you can customize your burgers here. You can choose between a 4oz or a 6oz patty, select different toppings (add a fried egg!) as well as choose your bun: egg bun, wheat bun, or spicy chipotle bun. I highly recommend the egg bun--slightly sweet and very fluffy. The service is very friendly and quick. But as mentioned, it's not worth going across the city to eat here.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Such an odd location for a solid burger joint. And yes, it's SOLID. Yummy burgers, clean interior, and best of all...the staff. I swear every single cashier I've encountered here is friendly and genuinely seems to care about your experience. I was there last weekend and thought it was 'business as usual' when I saw a friendly older man, 60+, at the register taking orders, a total straight shooter, friendly but not in a cheesy way, told customers "you can have your burger any way you like" and you could tell he meant it. Old school good customer service, I like! Well, turns out he's the General Manager (Tom) so of course I had to pay him a compliment, and it also prompted this review.

Because of the experiences I've had here, it's tempting to stop by anytime I do my grocery run at the Safeway there. Again, odd location (and wish their fries were fatter,) but definitely check it out when you need a fix. You won't regret it.
author: Jen E.

description:
There is far more going on at Smash burger than you might expect. The location for instance is a bit odd, its a strip mall where you find big box retailers like Ross, Office Depot and a Petco. Sort of unsuspecting to find a great jem hidden between these types of businesses. 

I had the pleasure of trying everything and I can tell you that everything is delicious. The burgers and sandwiches are all totally different from one another and this alone makes it possible for everyone to find something they are going to like. 

For me personally the Classic burger was one of my favorites. It's got a classic flavor that should make any burger lover take note. The way the cheese melts with the meat is so so gooey. It's got simple and clean flavors of charbroiled goodness that pair with french fries really well, it's a classic!

They have a Truffle Mushroom Swiss, that's a lot of truffle mixed with the perfectly gooey cheese. It's not overwhelming but it has a lot of flavor.  
The Bacon BBQ is my second favorite, it's not over the top but has that simple and clean taste. I think for me the thing it might have been missing to make it my favorite was just a bit more sauce or something to moisten it up.
The other burgers and sandwiches are all amazing. They have a regional burger (the bay burger) with fresh local flavors. The chicken club has bacon and chicken, so so good. And they have a vegetarian option, not my favorite but it was great. 

Here is the reason they are so good, it's all fresh,mostly local and they smash the burgers on the grill, they call it MEAT CANDY, how can that not be amazing? The burgers are way better than any mainstream chain. I love smashing things.
author: Ben M.

description:
I had many opportunities to dine at other Smash Burger restaurants in other cities. But at that time, it never happened. "I don't know why, so don't ask!"

But I am very happy that the franchise has opened the first restaurant in the city's Potrero shopping plaza; a plaza that lack any decent restaurants.

But the Smash Burger franchise has changed the perception unlike many of the other chained burger restaurants. 

From the menu (posted on the wall), there are no combo meals and every item is sold separately. I ordered the "Classic" Smash Burger with Cheese for $6.99 and a side order of "Smash Fries for $1.99. As soon I paid my meal (they accept my Visa card), I received a call number and sit my ass in the dining area. 

Within minutes, my meal was handed to me by a well-dressed waiter. That is professional service you will not receive from other burger places. 

My first bite of the famous Smash cheese burger, the burger was tasty and of course greasy. The "Smash" fries have thin shredded potatoes with a hint of aromatic herb of rosemary. My meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/smashburger-san-francisco?userid=HYQoxBC1y1DGPq6pGP09Tw#7mQ8c3STqhwkcE3Cox-vyQ

As I was enjoying my burger, I was continuing to browse through the menu for a definite future visit. The menu has many kinds of burgers, sides, vegan options including a salad and yes, "MILKSHAKES!" 

I am so happy that I got the monkey off my back and finally tried Smash Burger. Expect more visits from me.
author: Matt G.

description:
Date & Time:  Saturday September 21, 2013 @ 2pm 
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Baseball Caps & Nike FlyKnits
Music:  Hip Hop
Decor:  Contemporary Burger Joint
Service:  Very Friendly & Efficient
Imbibe:  Haagen-Dazs Oreo Malt
Devour:  Classic SmashBurger, Baja Burger, SmashFries & Veggie Frites
Total:  $23.76
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Rude people that work here, can't stand that in customer service. Are you joking me Smashburger with your phone antics? I tried to call to find out more information and the guy on the other line answered, then proceeded to make me feel stupid for trying to get more info on a to go order, to then hang up on me mid-sentence. People go to a crummy chain like Smashburger for repeatable and consistent service, without that, why would you even consider going there over a better, local place? Sorry, won't be coming here again, and honestly, not having good experiences across the entire chain. Is it really that hard to hire competent people who can speak to customers without dragging their knuckles?
author: Jake K.

description: Wow I can not believe there is a burger place that appreciates your business! The fresh burgers were out standing! A Haagen Dazs shake was what put it over the top ! Great food great service and great managers keep me coming back!! Did I tell you they have lots of free parking
author: Tom T.

description:
You know for a fast-casual burger chain, SmashBurger is pretty darn good. I'm glad I was finally in the neighborhood, having bookmarked this place for over a year, to finally try it out. 

Each location apparently has its own burger to reflect the city and thus my original bookmark was for the Bay Burger - arugula, portabella mushrooms, swiss, and truffle mayo between ciabatta. I totally forgot that was on the menu and got the truffle mushroom swiss burger instead. Overall nice flavors - the truffle flavor was really faint so you could taste the juicy burger and earthy mushrooms. I also ordered some Smashfries to go with my burger and if you like crispy shoestring fries, these are totally up your alley accept kicked up a notch with olive oil and herbs. All in, not too shabby for under $10.

Service is decent here but I must add that they actually do seem to enjoy being at work with lots of friendly banter between the staff and that totally rubs off on you. The only downside is location. I am seldom in the neighborhood but the next time I am, the Bay Burger will be ordered for sure. Add bacon.
author: Jon L.

description:
I love their burgers, it's pretty good for the price! I got the truffle mushroom Swiss burger an it melts in your mouth practically!

Oh and get the smash fries too!
author: J. Alexander G.

description: I'm happy with the food and service. Location isn't my favorite, but cobb salad with a side of buffalo sauce with grilled chicken is my go to. Management in the evening is mature and very welcoming. Burgers are good too.
author: April M.

description:
This is a great chain of restaurants, the first one I went to was in Emeryville, CA and I had nothing but great things to say about that location. Then I found this one. I usually start with the ambience then the service then the food but today I'll start with the good. 

Food; 
I got the Spinach, Cucumber and Goat Cheese big burger with a side of fries and let me say it was one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. I've been to many places but this combination by far is one of the best, companied with the thin fries it's awesome. Like I said on my tip always try a different burger when you come both beef and chicken. You want regret it!

Ambiance the good:
Well located with plenty of parking. The restaurant is big with plenty of seating and even a waiting table for orders to go. The decor is modern and funky with darker tones that are inviting and soothing at the same time. 

Ambiance the bad:
So let me tell you I walked in and placed my order and when I went to look for a place to sit I found plenty of tables. The problem was that about 10 empty tables had not been picked up so I had to pick one and clean it my self. I grabbed a napkin and some water to clean the table and put the dirty dishes on the side. 3 other groups had to do the same. 

Customer Service the good:
The young woman that took my order smiled and was engaging. I have nothing bad to say about her. They need more people like her in this place to bring it up more. And let me say the back of the house did an awesome job with my food. And they really work I could see them moving and getting things done asap.

Customer Service the bad:
The rest of the front staff was lazy and just acting dumb in a corner. Not smiling crossing their arms as they take customers orders. Not inviting at all. They need to replace a few employees in my opinion or give them additional training on customer service.

Final thoughts:
So the reason I don't give them a 5 was because of the bad service and having dirty tables over 10 dirty empty tables. But I will keep coming because of the food.
author: Victorino R.

description: Excellent burger joint! How is it compare to in-out? It is different and good in its own way. You would probably enjoy it. I def will come back when I have an urge for burger! Clean clean and spacious space. The staff are nice and attentive. :)
author: IHeartMambo S.

description: The good first aaaaaaah the burger was okaAY? Now the bad hmmmm OVER PRICED place is a DUMP dirty I mean dirty tables I mean ok over sized meat small buns & greasy as all hell! I COULD of asked a blind man that has no sense of smell or taste probably could have made me a better burger! NASTY
author: Mauricio S.

description:
I've always been a beef eater and love burgers! But I tried their chicken burgers with the condiments of my choice and realized that it's just as good and probably better than a hamburger! Wow..... The chicken is tender and juicy and the egg buns makes it taste so delicious.  

So if you're ever in the hood and need to eat something quick and cost less than a McDonald's #1 meal combo, come to this place and you'll be glad you did.
author: Lakeen W.

description:
Smash,

Look. I like you... probably a little too much.
You are going to make me fat... well i guess too late for that.

One thing I must share with the world is something people wouldn't expect. Get the crispy chicken version of whatever burger you want. I don't know if all smashburger locations make it the same, but that piping hot, crispy, juicy chicken is so worth it. Most of the time the chicken is twice the size of the bun. Way better than the beef burgers, not to mention a little bit healthier. 

I do have one "constructive feedback". Is that ok?
Your fries are... not great at all. When it's fresh and hot, it's ok, but really you guys need to do something about this. I am an avid fries lover and.. I'm going to say it.. even fries from jack in the box, mcdonalds, burger king and that random mom and pop burger place down the road all have better fries. Make it a little thicker, a little more crispier, a little more salty and I know you could improve.

But hey, that burger.. wow that makes me forget it all.

Also love how you can customize your burger by adding and subtracting things. I also appreciate the fizzy water you can from the machines. Yes please.

Oh and it's been useful to be able to order online, except you guys have some odd little restrictions on toppings online that is not explained. 

Anyways.. that chicken. yum.

Smash!

it's all about kirby.
author: Paul L.

description: Very disappointing in comparison to the first time a year or so ago ... Probably new ownership ... Portions smaller ... Beef quality awful ...french fries like on a ration ... Over price .. Definetly cutting corners ..ruining the good name of smash burger ..this one on 16th st. Is no good
author: Charles J.

description:
I've been meaning to try Smashburger ever since I saw they opened in the Potrero Plaza. Today, turned out to be the perfect opportunity since I needed to grab groceries at Safeway. As soon I as walked in I noticed how clean and bright the place was which isn't too surprising considering its still relatively new. 

The menu was clean and easy to follow. I have to agree that it was reminiscent of a McDonald's with a touch more sophistication. One quick glance at the signature burgers and you know it is SF influenced. 

I decided to try the 
Bay Burger: Baby arugula, sautéed baby portabella mushrooms, aged Swiss, and truffle mayo on a ciabatta bun + Smashfries: tossed with herbs and garlic 

Burger-meat itself needed more salt, not as juicy but was still tender 
Truffle mayo overpowered the dish and left a slick oily feeling in your mouth coating your tongue with truffle oil 
Rest of the ingredients were fresh but lacked presences, I hardly notice they were there 

Fries were your typical shoestrings, more texture than substance. The fries had a slight greasy shine to it but didn't taste heavy. The first couple handfuls were flavorful and delicious but half way through they became bland. I would have preferred more seasoning and evenly distributed.

Overall Thoughts

Quality is good but execution on seasoning gives me pause to give anything higher than 3 stars
author: Eddie W.

description: Never been to Smashburger before! Based on this meal, I'll be sure to continue avoiding each and every  location I see, for as long as I live in their proximity. Can you say super salty, mushy bean patty, weird bun, and greasy, dried out, ancient, flavorless fries? Me too! Let's quickly return to searching other Yelp reviews and avoid this ever happening to you!
author: Be F.

description:
16.01.13    First Visit

Burger ------------------- 3 1/2


Large capacity.
They do not do medium rare.

Have a nice char to the patty.
Because it doesn't do medium rare ... my preferred.
It was still kinda moist.

Uses a paging system ... so the food is delivered to you.

Open fountain allows you to have refill.

Located at the old AutoCenter space @ the eastern side of the lot.
Near Daiso.
author: S.K. Y.

description:
For a chain burger place, this isn't too bad. Prices are reasonable considering the food is really tasty. This place has a decent dining area, and it is very clean. 

The staff seems pretty friendly. This will be a frequent place for me.
author: Taylor G.

description:
I have always been a fan of Smashburger after visiting their San Diego location a few years ago and when I found out they were opening a location here in the city I must say I was stoked! I have been to this location several times and honestly it doesn't seem as good as I recall it being in SD.

Not saying it's not a good spot to grab a bite, there are numerous options and the staff is friendly but I can't recall having that "damn, now that's what I call a burger" feeling after scarfing down what they put in front of me at this location.

One thing that separates Smashburger from other typical burger joints is that they create special burger's and chicken sandwiches that are specifically made for the location or area the restaurant is in. For instance in San Diego it was a avocado topped burger with fresh cilantro, pepper jack cheese, sour cream and chipotle mayo with a wedge of lime on a telera roll. Now that was a great burger! 

Here at the SF location it's called the Bay burger and its topped with baby arugula, crimini mushrooms, swiss and a truffle mayo on a ciabatta bun. Also good but not sure if it screams Bay Area. Also on the menu that's not at most places are their Rosemary, garlic and Italian olive oil tossed fries aka smashfries. These things can be addictive! 

Unfortunately my last visit consisted of a luke warm burger and cold smashfries... Guess it's time to smash on by on my way to another establishment to get my burger on... 

I'll be back, just not sure when.
author: Josh H.

description: Came here with my girlfriend to grab a early dinner at 5:30pm on 8/17/16. I had the BBQ Bacon Cheddar Big Smash Combo and she had the Avocado Club Big Smash Combo. The combo comes with either choice of fries which is regular or their smash fries(rosemary and garlic oil). Having a combo will be an extra $4.39 and an extra 10¢ for the smash fries. Everything was perfect. Taste was on point. Will come again soon!!
author: Nick F.

description:
Went for the first time today & the burgers are pretty good. I loved the grilled onions on my truffle burger. You can really taste the mushrooms...which I like. 

I also like their fries. Nice & crispy. Dipped with mayo makes it even better. 

Burgers are good...not the best though. But it's a very clean restaurant. I'd go back if I was in the area or in the mood.
author: Ralph N.

description: Was in The New Hyde Park Store 0n 4/7/17.. and almost walked    dirty floor, tables not cleaned... When the order was finally delivered to the table   one order looked sad  and the other was wrong...   a small leaf of lettuce and a paper thin slice of tomao on a cheese burger... I sent mine back  and waited even longer...   what I got was not nothing like the photos....again one small leaf of lettuce the thinnest slice of tomato and pickle...  and it was a bit over smashed..   The important thing tatste...  Over salty....and greesy,,  that the bun was falling apart....It was the first and last time.....was still jungry when I lelf....   and don't ask about getting a water....LOL
author: James S.

description:
I love this place! Been here several times and had wonderful service and great food, except for this past weekend. I got my usual burger, but it was on a flat plain bun - not the delicious egg bun it always comes with.. So I asked the server/cashier if I could get it switched to the correct
Bread. She returned and said the manager informed her that it WAS on an egg bun (not true). My friend had ordered a burger on an egg bun and his was completely different look and taste than mine. After a little back and forth with the manager and kitchen staff, I finally got my delicious egg bun- but by this time my burger was lukewarm/cold. The server was great (I think she was new and that's why she didn't know the difference) but she was very nice. The manager, not so much. Quite a hassle when it was an easy solution. Pretty disappointed in th overall experience.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Way past dinner time on Sunday night.  I really wanted a burger.  A really good burger.  But I wanted to try a place I haven't been to yet.  I first thought of Rickybobby.  They're closed on Sundays.  Then I thought of Garaje.  They're closed on Sundays, too (?!).  I've heard about Smashburger, read my trusted Yelp friends' reviews, & since they were actually OPEN, decided they would be my Sunday Supper Burger choice.  

And then I saw that they have a private parking lot?!  I was almost friggin beside myself.  Drivers in SF, you know of what I speak.  A truffle burger AND private parking?!  For chrisake.  This is about when I thought I could hear angels faintly singing from up above.

I ordered everything to go.

Truffle mushroom Swiss burger.  Bliss.
Smash fries: olive oil, rosemary, & garlic.  Even more bliss.  I could not stop eating them in the car on my way home.  I tried.  I just could not.
Had I ordered an Oreo or a Nutter Butter shake, it would actually have been even more blissful.
Or the Butterfinger Oreo shake.  Or the PB&J shake...you get the gist.

Now I was certain I could hear angels singing.  An awesome meal.  Exactly what I needed & wanted, & they exceeded my expectations.  They were even nice enough to cut the burger in half for me.  I ate half for dinner, & saved the other half for breakfast the next day.  My bar of measure for burgers, pizza, & Chinese food...is it still delish the next morning for breakfast?

They SO passed.  They cut the mustard.  LOL
Sorry.

De-effin-licious.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: I love the food, and the ambiance is nice. What I didn't care for that the employee's see me and talk like I'm not even there, if you're busy LOOK at the customer and say "Someone will be right with you".
author: Anthony B.

description:
I cannot count how many times my colleagues and I've visited this place. Every week, someone says "let's go smashing" and everyone's on board. 

The burger is fresh and yummy, reasonably priced, and comes in big volume. The staffs are polite and friendly. 

Keep serving great burgers! We'll be there in a week or two!
author: Noriko M.

description: What a delicious burger!   I built my own and it was the JAM!  It's a world of difference from any fast food burger.  I will be back!
author: Raleigh T.

description:
Smash Burger smashes it! My first encounter with SB was in Denver last fall. My conference hotel was a block from SB and I ate there four times. My heart skipped a beat when I found the local branch.

As always the burger was great, the haystack onions perfect and the place clean as a whistle. They serve the burgers open-face with really fresh vegetables on an egg bun. Of course, you can make your own burger with choice of bread and fixings to suit your taste.

I'm in love all over again! Now I have to resist eating there every day.
author: John A.

description:
This place is cool and pretty hip.
The portions are pretty good and I like the atmosphere.

The shakes and burgers are really good.
I love the sauces on the burgers ..mmm yum.

I liked the cheese selection and the way the buns taste. 

SUper smashing I must say!
author: Luke S.

description:
Smashburger be smashin like Nigel Thornberry! I have no idea what that means. Don't even know if it's a good or a bad thing. Oh wells.

Carrying on, Smashburger was just alright. The burger itself was a little boring. As in, the meat had zero flavor. No taste at all. Kind of dry as well. The rest of the burger was pretty fresh though. Veggies were pretty delicious. But nobody eats burgers for the veggies, so Smashburger kind of failed me there.

Their fries are pretty fantastic though. So good, I could see myself here just for their Smash fries. Thin cut fries seasoned with rosemary? Can't really go wrong there. I thought it was a weird flavor at first, but I found myself just eating more and more and eventually I finished all the fries and I wanted more. Super delicious. Very oily though. Can't see this as being a healthy dish at all.
