Finally got to try Smashburger, and I was a little underwhelmed by it. Probably gonna pass on their burgers, but their fries are pretty top notch!
author: Sean H.

description: Delicious. I had to take a bus 20 mins in the wrong direction all because I'm addicted to the bbq bacon grilled chicken sandwich. Good service. Clean restaurant. Great food.
author: Crystal J.

description:
I came during the lunch rush this pass week and I must say management has gone under. I been coming to Smashburger for the past two years and I have seen many employees come and go, but for the worst. There was a young African American male who was serving out the food from the Expo window who dreads smell of dead bodies as if he haven't washed his hair in years. He was delivering our food and I was not pleased as customer services begins with hygiene.

Not only did his dreads smell but his manager an older Caucasian male was just sitting in front of the expo window handing food to him and yelling loudly to the cooks in the back. It seemed more like a slave plantation than an actually causal dining restaurant. I see this often that manager hardly works or seems to be apart of the team.

Overall, my colleagues and I are very disappointed in Smashburger's declining environment. We will proudly take our funds to another causal dining restaurant.
author: Gabrielle H.

description:
Smashburger gets it right every time. What is not to like? Everything on their menu is so spot on.

The patty? Big, tasty, juicy, fresh.
The bun? Perfectly done, not too fluffy, just right.
The salad? Large portion, nicely decorated.
The milk shake? Haagen Dazs galore. It can't get any better than this.

My favorites are the Truffle Mushroom Swiss Burger ($7) with Sweet Potato Fries, slightly salted. When I take vegetarian friends they usually order the salad which comes in a large bowl for reasonable $8. And if I forget everything I learned about nutrition I get one of the Haagen Dazs milk shakes, and I'm in heaven ($5).
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Our go to spot for burgers  ;)

Good burgers, shakes and sweet potatoe fries!
author: Nan P.

description:
The workers looks like they absolutely hated their jobs. The burgers itself was pretty good. I order the fries will franks red hot sauce and it was a bit too salty for my preference. My friends ordered a milk shake and they said they were out of straws. 

The place looked terribly managed. This restaurant needs a new manager and new staff.
author: Herman L.

description:
Came here today for lunch and thought it was one of the best chicken burger I had in awhile.  Glad to find go to a burger joint that serve chicken, not like in n out.  I am not a beef eater, so a chicken option is awesome in my book.  I got the truffle, mushroom, Swiss cheese chicken burger.  It was meshed well and not messy at all.  It was just very tasty.  We split the smash fries which was nice and thin and crispy.  

The guy at the cashier could be little more friendly.  I go for the experience and not just the food.  Food memorable, but staff not as much.
author: James L.

description:
Parking lot that can get full sometimes.  It's in that little outdoor mall on Potrero and 16th.

I like that they open at 10am.  Early lunch options are hard to find.

A guy cleaning the window also ran back and forth running the register and sorting the food after its cooked from the food prep area.  REALLY nice guy.  He's doing it all.  

Made my own burger and also decided to get the onion haystack.

Loved it....but, everything was seasoned well.  I guess the meaning of well really means a lot, or like well done.  Too much.

I liked it but would prefer it was less seasoned.  I'll remember to ask for low or less salt.  

Really good selection and the price was good.  I'll be back again.
author: Bing D.

description:
Pretty solid burger chain!

Now as a food snob, I think I'm supposed to hate this place because they won't cook your burger any less than "medium well to well done."  Nonetheless the burgers here have been consistently super juicy, and they even have a magical little bit of "crust" on one side.  Which I will henceforth assume is a result of them using their heavily touted "burger smasher."  Which, according to their plentiful burger smasher marketing materials, is shaped like someone made the pentagon out of play dough and then squished it until the 5 corners became rounded.

Anyway, the BBQ Bacon Cheddar smash is excellent as is the "original smash" which is basically a cheeseburger.  Their "smash fries" are also a winner; they're just regular french fries with enough olive oil and rosemary to make you feel like you're dining in San Francisco.  Oh wait, you are.
author: Aaron M.

description:
How should i put this. When you're tucked away in a huge plaza in a hidden hole in the wall space where you're competing with jamba juice, safeway petco and vitamin shoppe....yeah you're probably nothing special.

Not to say this is below fast food quality, but to briefly state, SmashBurger is the equivalent to the hype that surrounded T-Pumps

Let me explain-

A) When you walk in,  the options do seem much more appealing than the following:
McDonald's, The Habit and The Counter. (+1)

B) for the standard under 10 dollar meal you get from In-And-Out burgers, it will cost you $15.95 here..... Yeah very unimpressed.

$7-$9.79 for the burger alone, regardless of type....uhhh ....huh...
3-5 Dollars for a Haagen Dazs shake...nice and thick
3-5 Dollars for overrated "smash" Fries.....bleh...nothing special.

Let me just say, those fries are honestly sh*t fries cause its no different from the thin fries you could get from Barney's Gourmet Burgers.

C) When the burger comes out after they "smash" your meat as it says on their decor caption, it looks like a bigger version of a Wendy's Burger.

In review, this is an upgrade from Mcdonalds down the street however, it should not be an every week thing if you are more of a Barney's/Umami burger kind of person. but if you're. Wendy's, Jack in the crack kinda burger bopper. Well heres your heaven.

D)The bacon cheeseburger should not have mustard in it by the way....it kills the bacon flavor.....this aint mcdonalds where nearly every burger got mustard ..
Even without onions it ended up tasting like a spoiled double quarter pounder with bacon from mcdonalds.....

Someone's gotta  be a better quality control before they out it on the menu.....
Its like chinese food, not everything goes good with rice..unless your just a lazy cook..

I hate to give a clean place a shit review so soon, but ...its just a very uninspiring place....doesn't look to different from The habit quite honestly
author: Eric C.

description:
Patties are large and juicy. The first thing you'll notice is the bun is soft but holds up. Ingredients are fresh and don't spill all over the place like Super Duper. Most popular burger seems to be the Classic Smash. Truffle burger is amazing, not much different from the Bay Burger. Veggie burger is a black bean patty and not some frozen disk of unknown veggies. Chicken burgers are a healthy alternative. Don't miss the milkshakes, especially the Oreo shake.

Oh and see the photo attached for the SECRET MENU. Only two burgers on it, but if you're a fan of adding a fried egg to a burger, the Sin City is for you!
author: Calvin W.

description: Tom was great!  He was very personable and cared that I had my burger cooked just the way I like it and offered to do it himself.  Truly unbeatable service!!!
author: Diana R.

description:
I came here for the Yelp Elite event a few weeks back, and basically got to try, well, every single one of the items on their menu, so I'm not going to go and rate each individual one. But, overall, everything they have to offer is pretty solid, from their various burgers, to their sides, to their shakes (which are made with Haagen Daz ice cream!). Fantastic, they are not, but solid, they are, falling somewhere in between the fast food world and the fancy burger world, in the same tier as, say, Super Duper.

Some interesting tidbits: they're named what they are because they take fresh meat (ground beef, chicken, etc) and smash it into a super hot griddle, which simultaneously sears, steams, and quickly cooks the meat. Also, while they have set items on their menus, their burgers are actually customizable, for those who like playing with their food. And with the variety of buns, proteins, and ingredients to pick from, there's plenty of combinations to come up with!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Spacious venue, with a combination of inaccessible counter height tables, and lower standard height tables and booths.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, but I imagine they're okay.
author: Johnny W.

description:
My first impress was "this is going to be delicious". The menu was simple, yet full of choices... there was honest tea at the fountain and a few select beers... the layout was attractive as well. 

I ordered a chicken club with a side of bbq sauce on a wheat bun, side of sweet potato fries. To be honest, I am still trying to figure out what I thought. The chicken was paper thin, there were 3 small slices of avocado, and single strip of lettuce. Wasn't the most elegant or juicy chicken sandwich I ever had. It didn't really fill me, but the flavor sure was delicious. I was a bit disappointed with the portions. 

Overall... for the cost, I think there are better places to go. I know that "artisan" and unique burger joints are on the up and up, but the most important thing to me is a good portion for the cost. For the $11 I spent, I excepted more than what I got. I would prefer a joint like the habit way over SmashBurger. 

Overall... wasn't sold on it.
author: Matt L.

description: Really great black bean burger.  So fresh and tasty.  I usually don't like this kind of place to eat but I was impressed.  I loved how they use reusable metal baskets, have a wide range of sauces, coke zero fountain drinks.   Clean and friendly and easy and loved my healthy lunch.
author: Scott H.

description:
Hands down my favorite fast food burger. It just dissolves in your mouth.

Friendly staff, clean dining area, all-around a great place.
author: Christopher B.

description: This place is great for a good burger and somewhere to hangout. I love how much you can play with all the food and basically make all the food to your own desire. Tom is full of energy and always quick to a conversation. Overall this place is awesome and I love eating here.
author: Sandra S.

description:
I eat here once  a week and always have the cobb salad without chicken, dressing tossed.
It is freshly made and always seriously good. Tom the manager is very  much on the floor 
checking in with all the customers, and picking up the slack with the staff when needed. 
I always go with a friend who also has the same cobb salad and we split a hamburer
which is also good. The cobb salad is comparable to ones that I have paid $15.00+
Restaurant is always spotlessly clean.
author: Peter F.

description: Mediocre quality, very slow service, messed up on the order even after several reminders not to add goat cheese, and employees arguing openly among each other. Never going back again.
author: Al G.

description:
Super disappointed in this place - love their hamburgers but twice - TWICE - forgot the bacon I ordered, and when I reminded them about it, argued they were out of cooked bacon. I guess they didn't want to make more since it was near closing time, but then they should have told me upfront that it wasn't available! They did finally made some but after a lot of back and forth.

The third strike was last week when we got there at 9:25 (restaurant closes at 10) and after waiting in line for 5 minutes told us they were taking to go orders only because they didn't want people staying late. RUDE! We've been there before and around the same time and make sure we leave right at 10. I will miss the tasty burgers but will not spend time or money in a place with lousy customer service.
author: Ginaville V.

description: i want to say that its not worth it the burgers are 6.99$ and small as well you need to pay extra for fries and drinks so that sucks!! and they put too much condiments it was nasty and soggy the burgers i got a stomach ache for that. the fries are too small and the milkshake aint even good! the worst part its not even delicious!!!
author: Daniella E.

description: First visit, I asked for less salt on my burger. Naturally, they threw in extra salt for the minor request. Second visit, ordered the grilled chicken truffle mushroom burger to go. Back in the office, I took it out of the bag and it was smashed flat. Spoke to a manager who didn't give rat's ass. I will post a pic.
author: Jay W.

description:
I decided to try this since I have heard the food was good. I ordered the BBQ and bacon cheddar burger with smash fries and my boyfriend ordered the truffle Swiss with chicken and spicy buffalo fries. The burgers were both great, smash fries were the best, but the buffalo one is super salty so watch out for that! 
However, the people who worked there were not the greatest. My friends had ordered two milkshakes and when we asked one of the girls she turned around and told the other two guys that they forgot to make them. Instead of realizing their mistakes they kinda shrugged it off so the girl went to the back to make them. She didn't seem that happy and was looking kinda irritated the whole time but I would be too since she seemed like she was the one doing everything almost.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Bay Burger - This was much better than I thought it would be...the meat itself was good, but I really enjoyed everything else that helped to make it a better overall burger: truffle mayo, chiabatta roll, arugula.  We also had some truffle fries and milkshakes, which were also above average.

The burgers arrive as "regular" or "big"...I'd say the "big" wasn't very big, but more of a typical sized burger.  The "regular" portion would probably be good for those who have a smaller appetite or intend on eating fries and a milkshake.

I would definitely recommend this place if you happen to be in the area and have a craving for a good burger.
author: Ken G.

description:
I am updating my review which used to be at a 1 due to screwed up orders.

They've gotten mine right lately.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I got to say I'm surprised that this is a pretty good burger joint with the potential to be great. Although the burgers are a bit salty, it's everything you want in a burger place.

There seems to be a new trend with burger places that allows you to build your own burger and enjoy fresh ingredients. Although it comes at a higher price tag, it almost guarantees you to have the exact burger you want without any skimping on the trimmings taste. A real bonus is everything made here is cooked to order. Unlike many fast food chains which have them cooked and then place them under a heat lamp to keep em warm. By doing that you take away the texture and natural flavor of the meat patty and replace it with a rubbery feel and leaves it with a Spongy taste to it.

I ordered the BBQ bacon cheeseburger. It's served on a golden brown egg bun with huge cuts of hickory smoked bacon. Combine that with a half pound party and Swiss cheese. I took it a step further by adding an egg on top to complete this massive meal of perfection. Although it was a bit saltier than expected, the burger was excellent. It was juicy, it was runny, it was messy but more importantly it was tasty.

The fries were average and I was a little disappointed because there was so much emphasis made about these fries and how much better they're supposed to taste. I've heard it placed higher then other chains like in & out and McDonald's. But I will say this the venue is a lot bigger than it looks from the outside and the staff was cordial. The only downside was the loud conversations they were having that everyone in the smash burger could hear. Of you know you're at work and have a. Open kitchen, be aware of what you're talking about because it can sound extremely unprofessional. 

But other than that, I feel as an all around burger place. Smash burger definitely deserves a strong four-star rating.
author: Donald W.

description: I've eaten here about 10 times. The food is pretty good. I would even rate the food 5 stars. Burgers are great, milkshakes are great. HOWEVER, they hire the most rude and careless, inconsiderate employees with the "I don't give a shit attitude". They're snappy, ghetto, and roll their eyes, like they're better than you. I would rate the service negative stars if I could. It really ruins the entire experience of this place. Extremely unfortunate.
author: Vincent N.

description:
The only burger chain I ever enjoyed was In & out that is until getting to try my first Smashburger at a North Bay elite event.

I am so thankful I dont have to head north to enjoy the perfectly juicy and fresh burgers here anymore!

My favorites are the classic smash and the bay burger which you can also get on a whole wheat bun and add or take off toppings. The rosemary fries are good (although I wish they offered garlic) but the sweet potato fries are my favorite.  They carry honest tea,  IPA's and my favorite milk shakes made with hagggendaz ice cream! 

In fact, I've convinced the hubbs to have dinner there tonight! *happy dances* :)
author: Petra S.

description: Great burgers and fries! Lots of choices... Reminds me of a reasonable priced "The Counter". The Spicy Baja burger is my favorite! Definitely my favorite reasonably priced burger places... Just wish they were located closer to my home!
author: David L.

description:
Nothing special. 

The burgers aren't anything to write home about, so definitely DO NOT make it a destination. Order your burger, you can customize it if you like... Pay extra for fries. I opted for sweet potato fries. They were tasty without ketchup.

1 "large" sized bacon cheeseburger w/ smash fries (fries tossed in olive oil and rosemary apparently) and a soda
1 "regular" sized bacon cheeseburger w/ sweet potato fries and a soda


The "large" bacon cheeseburger looked almost exactly the same size as my "regular'. The meat patty only appeared to be "larger" by a centimeter or two.

total = $23

was it worth it? 


not really.

I want those calories back -_-
author: Susy C.

description:
I have been waiting for a Smashburger in our area for years! After going to them in Arizona and Vegas, I knew it would be a matter of time before a Smashburger of our own. I went last Saturday and really liked the location. Ample parking, lots of seating, and very clean. 

I order the caliburger and was not disappointed. The thin show string fries are insanely delicious and the Milkshakes are too die for. The cashier was very friendly and didn't get irritated when it took me a few minutes to figure out what I wanted. Saturday nights seem kinda slow so if you don't like dealing with crowds it's the perfect time to go. The prices were on par with the other locations I've been too which is great considering how much lore everything is in our beloved city. Overall great burger, great value, and great atmosphere.
author: Brandi W.

description:
My first experience with smash burger was a good one.The line was long but the wait was not that bad
It moved at a fair pace.I ordered the smash burger with cheese on the egg bun with a vanilla shake& smash fries. The burger was cooked to perfection
And the fires were very good the milk shake as well
I Wil defiantly eat at the 16th street location again
author: Derik S.

description:
The burger patty lacked flavor, as though it wasn't seasoned. The fries hit the table Luke warm. The staff was friendly, but that doesn't make up for mediocre food.

They weren't terribly busy on our visit and yet it wasn't as clean as I'd like.

Given the option for awesome burgers in SF I don't feel the need to return.

If you want an awesome inexpensive burger go to Garaje. If money is no object hit Tap415 at the Westfield - Tempura bacon is the bomb!
author: David P.

description: 5 stars  for the burger patty and the crispy chicken patty. Their sweet potatoes fries are great. Wasn't really amazed by the salads, I have tried their salad a few times and I have always found that the salads aren't portioned well. But everyone is here for burger so who cares. The service is fast but okay.
author: Sabrina G.

description:
I've been here for lunch many times since it opened. The burgers here are deliciously juicy compared to those from other places.

I still like their classic burger the most. Some of their other burgers such as the mushroom or avocado ones have a slightly drier texture and aren't as appetizing.

Service here is extremely good.
author: Nathan Y.

description:
So i went back 2 days after i wrote the initial review to see if it was a fluke and it wasn't. I went there again tonight to give it a final try and its been consistent. I will probably have a heart attack if i go there one more time this week. 

Do you remember when in n out first open up and it was always a treat to eat there. I think i found my in n out alternative. Although SmashBurger cost twice it does offer a more premium taste compared and more options.

This is my new fav burger joint. *Does not mean i think its the best tasting burger in the world! 

Check it out - I highly recommend it!
author: Ryan R.

description:
Smashburger is another burger chain. only cooks burger medium or medium well.

drill: order, pay, food brought to table when ready

eats: classic (reg.5.99?)
-had cheddar cheese, red onions, tomato, lettuce, mayo
-med. burger had no taste, no burger juice
taste better than 5 guys, sonic, MCD. similar to BK, wendy's
-"juice" was either fat or liquid from veggies.
-everything fresh re: burgers.

crumbs:
-good service overall, nice ambience.
ambience 4 stars, burger 3 stars.
author: Victor G.

description:
So good! 2nd burger place that I've actually learned to crave. The first being In n' Out, of course.

Try the: 
-truffle mushroom swiss classic. 
so so good, so so juicy. definitely my favorite burger here

-bbq, bacon, and cheddar.
oh my god good. think arby-q, but 100x better. 

-classic smash.
most comparable to the in and out varities.  good alternative if you can't make the drive out to an in and out

Overall, all of their beef burgers were fantastic, the above were my top 3.


Some notes:
-most of their beef burgers are served on egg buns, which apparently makes a huge difference! I believe their chicken burgers have ciabatta and their vegetarian/ bean burgers come on a wheat bun
-burgers are literally smashed! they use a special tool to smash and turn their beef balls into patties- keeps all the burger juice in. my mouth is watering thinking about it
-if you are going for the vege burger, not that it has a spicy kick to it. 
-oreo milkshake is surprisingly better than the salted caramel variety
author: Patricia K.

description:
After jumping the gun last week by two days prior to the grand opening day, I made it over for lunch a few days later with hubby and daughter. 

The laminated menus are located to the right of the front entrance.  You can read it to determine what you would like to order prior to the ordering at the counter which is 1/2 way in.  There's also a menu posted above at the order counter.  

I went with the classic smash burger.  Comes with cheese and the special sauce dressing with lettuce, tomato, Bermuda onions, and pickles on an egg bun. You can order either the regular burger or the bigger one.  You can also customize your burger.

The garnish was ice cold.  I took everything off my burger as I enjoy eating hot food hot and not lukewarm.  The ground beef patty was good.  Beefy.  And the patty looked like one that I would make at home.  Thin patty. 

We got two sides - French fries and sweet potato fries.  Good portion size.  Ketchup and mustard on the table with lots of napkins.  You'll need them as the burger is very juicy. 

They've got bottled beverages and a soda fountain. 

The staff walks around frequently to ask how's everything.  They also suggest you go online to complete a survey.  Then next time you can get fries for free.  

Everyone is very friendly.  Service was quick for food cooked to order.  It's served in a steel wired basket.
author: Shirley N.

description:
I've had the Smashburger from Sacramento before so I was extremely disappointed when I finally got to try this place out. 

For $7 a burger, I expected a lot more. I got the bacon cheeseburger to share and it was not that great at all. The smell of onions overpowered the entire burger and I had to pick most of it out. The fries were DRENCHED in oil. This was the first time in any fast food place that I got napkins to soak up oil on french fries before I ate them. When i got to half the pile, I ended up individually wiping the oil off each french fry because I really didn't want to eat. But in the end, I never really finished the fries because I felt like my arteries were gonna clot up.

Oh yea, I saw the server reach in under his shirt to casually scratch himself not giving a care in the world and showing off the naval. Then he went straight back to work without washing his hands.

Ummmm, I think I'll be skipping Smashburger from now on.
author: Harriet W.

description:
My review echos others. I am a smashburger loyalist so this is more about this particular location rather than the food itself. Im originally from San Diego where the local special the san diego burger is amazing. Still I knew there was other food that would suffice.

Cashier gave attitude. Later I saw her arguing with the manager in the middle of the restaurant. My food just sat at the heat lamp. I heard the manager say you forgot the fries. which took another 10 minutes. Food comes back luke warm.

The restaurant had a moldy water smell in the back. There was a table that had a milkshake all over the floor and it was congealed like its been there for a while. Most of the tables had not been bussed even though the place was empty.

Management or the franchise needs to step their game up. Place was disgusting.

The food was meh ok. But not the food I loved from San Diego.
author: Jon O.

description:
Yep, there are better burgers in SF, but this is not a gourmet burger place -  this is more upscale fast food burger with great toppings and a fresh bun.  I had the one with bacon , cheese and frizzled onions (added an egg of course and would have preferred it to be runny, next time I'll be more specific).  it really hit the spot.  If I had it to do over, I would have gone whole hog and gotten the double and  the super thin onion strings or sweet potato fries on the side.

Fast service, clean place, fountain soda, nice employees, free parking, a great selection of fried sides and topping choices.  The shakes looked great and "fat in a cup" - in a good way.

McDonalds across the street, Togo's next door, and Boston Market downstairs should be worried.
author: Amy W.

description:
Dear SmashBurger,

Today, I ruined my diet for you.  Your name has been engraved in my head because of SlickDeals.  It was impossible for me to turn down a coupon for a new chain that opened up close to home. 

Your burger became a bigger mess with each bite that I took.  It drove me crazy.  My buns were not toasted, so it became this huge soggy mess.  Plus, your fries were overly salty.  However, your ice cream shake was pretty amazing!

Remember, when something seems too good to be true, it usually is.

Regretfully yours,
Killed My Diet
author: Lynn L.

description:
Decent spot for a burger fix if you're in the area... they're juicy and on the saltier side, but definitely fresh. Especially liked the Oreo milkshake. 

Easy parking in the lot, not too crowded, and nice seating options inside. Staff was polite.
author: Josh L.

description:
I waited 30 minutes for my order while my boyfriend waited until I got it to eat his salad. 

But to complain, I had to get in line behind:
- a couple who kept getting the wrong order corrected...four times
- the woman with her salad bowl because they forgot the kitchen
- some man that was mad about beer or something

Not to mention I could hear loud uncomfortable arguments in the kitchen. This was the hottest of messes - it is a symptom of new franchising? If so this place needs to clean up quick. 

I was too entertained to leave. 

And, if you're wondering they forgot my order.
author: Bao N.

description:
My bf heard of this Denver food chain from his coworker, and wanted to try it. We also needed a burger place to eat at before my event at 12. So, Smashburger was one of the only places open believe it or not!

When walking in, everything was so clean (brand new). The menus are on flatscreen TVs, similar to McDonalds. I ended up getting the Avacado Club (Fresh avocado, applewood-smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, ranch dressing and mayo on a multi-grain bun). My bf got the Bay Burger (Baby arugula, sautéed baby portabella mushrooms, aged Swiss, and truffle mayo on a ciabatta bun). Avacado Club was good, but I was disappointed in the lettuce; it was just one thin piece. I did like the multi-grain bun since it was different and made me feel good for eating "healthy."  The Bay Burger was super good though - can't go wrong with that truffle mayo. 

Fries were alright; really thin shoestring variety. I was hoping for thicker fries. The fries were also pretty greasy...but still good. At first we ordered one to share, but then I ended up wanting to get one for myself since I didn't feel full yet.  Best part, I went up to order the fries. The manager asked, "Do you want free fries? Fill out the survey on your receipt and you can get them free!" Awesome. Made my day.

Great service...good food. Will be returning.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I got the black bean smashburger. I guess I was naive, I didn't realize they actually smashed the burger flat. So what I got was actually pretty tasty, but it was all spread out thick falling out the sides and super thin in the middle..inside the bun. It was strange, I had to pick the pieces from the edges and stick them back in because I had lost about 1/2 the burger into the wrapper as I ate it!

the fries were fine, nothing special. The employees were apathetic. I don't think I'd come back here.
author: Venus S.

description:
Had the Bay Burger and Smash fries. Juicy tasting burger and well seasoned fries. Get some sauces on the side for dipping ur fries. Great friendly service too.

I'm not that big a fan of their shakes because they blend with ice.
author: Craig I.

description:
This reminds me of a really nice, high quality, well organized and hip McDonald's with San Francisco prices.  It's OK.

I ordered the smash fries and a bacon cheese burger with a soda. The fries are good and I'd have them again. The burger is not juicy. After finishing the burger there was not one drop of water on my tray. The sign of a juicy burger is you have a messy tray when you finish. My tray was clean.   

Everything about my experience was good but for $13 the taste was not worth my time. The employees are very friendly and the restaurant is exceptionally clean. Likelihood of returning 24%.
author: Justin S.

description:
I've never taken the time to write a negative review, but I was just treated as rudely as I've ever been at an ordering station. I go here about twice a week-- it's by my gym, it's usually clean, and there are several healthy options.

Tonight I walked in at 9:35-- they close at 10pm -- and the woman on the floor rolled her eyes, said "oh my god," and walked to the register, saying "that's it, I'm quitting!" The manager, who's usually friendly enough, looked frustrated and walked away when he saw me walk in.

 I'm friendly and even tip for fast food. I've worked food service and know it can be very frustrating, but I never treated customers, especially a friendly one, this way. I would have been fired. With 25 minutes till closing, I planned to order to go, but I opted to leave. I won't be going back.
author: Brent C.

description: I think the service here was a bit strange (cashier acted oddly/confused when taking my order), but otherwise a decent burger chain that's close by to me. Great for a quick meal thats relatively inexpensive. Gets a pass for being in SF where you really have no in-n-out or five guys as alternatives.
author: Omar M.

description: It's decent.  Parking sux in Portrero Center, and door dings are a given from the miniature parking spaces. The burgers are pretty good, but very greasy.  I am not a fan of the chicken sandwiches - they use a paper thin chicken breast? and it overcooks and is bland.  The fries we got today were so salty I couldn't finish, and I am a salt lover.  The shakes are excellent. Prices so-so; about $11 for sandwich, fries and a drink.
author: Ken P.

description: First time here and I loved it. First things first. Parking is great. Plenty of parking. Walking into this establishment was pleasant experience. When you walk in you see a all open floor plan, a lot of open seating and various options for seating. You can sit at the "bar like" section, or you can sit at the table "booth like" seats, they even have a more private seating towards the back. Very very clean and neat. Everything is organized and labeled in bold and bright colors. Ordering your food is easy and the customer service is excellent! My order was cooked to order and brought out to me pretty fast. I must add "Linda" one of the servers was so so so sweet and friendly! She was very attentive and such a sweet lady. "Tom" the general manager was also very delightful and you could see he was managing and maintaining the whole joint without any issues or Complications. Tom was very attentive to every person walking through the door even with splurges of people coming and going. The food was delicious and FRESH. YOU COUKD TASTE THE FRESHNESS in every bite. I really liked the variety they offered on their menu, not too much but different from other burger joints. They also thanked me for coming in and gave me a free cup with some free coupon flyers to come back again! This place is definitely on one of my new favorite places to go! I'll be bringing everyone I know back to try them out too! Family friendly. Great for meeting up with friends. Cards are accepted but $100.00 bills not so much. For sure for sure you have to try this spot!
author: Reina Linda H.

description: Made online order. I went to pick up, there were many people in line for lunch. I got my order quickly, but after I went back to my work place i found out that they didn't give me my large fries that I paid for and was clearly written on my receipt. I tried to call them to get money back, and all the guy said was that he will take care of me next time. But he can't even hear my name and he brushed me off.  Inaccuracies and careless customer service!
author: Dixon W.

description:
I've been to this location three times now, and each time the amount of waiting I had to do was unbelievable. It probably took an average of 30 minutes to get a burger -- the line doesn't move very quickly and it takes a while for the burgers to actually get made.

The burgers are fine, but nothing special enough to call home about. It definitely wasn't worth the wait. I've gotten the Spicy Jalapeño Baja chicken sandwich and the Avocado Club burger twice. The  chicken wasn't very crispy, but the lettuce was really good and had a nice crunch. The Avocado Club was just too soggy to be a good burger -- the bottom bun was always soaked with grease. Probably won't go here again.
author: John W.

description:
Classic Smashburger rivals the likes of Shake Shack and In N out. Trust me.

Their crispy chicken sandwich was the juiciest I've ever had.
author: Viet P.

description: Had the Bay Burger, Spicy Baja Burger, sweet potato fries and onion rings and they were all very good (onion rings could be less salty). What I really like about this location is that the staff are all very friendly and courteous and you can tell they take great pride in keeping the place very clean and organized, down to the napkins and condiment baskets on each table. Will keep going back for sure!
author: cassy f.

description:
If I could give 0 stars I would.
The Host :: Amarion 
The worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. I had never been to a smash burger before and I will not be returning. He huffed and puffed when I  asked simple questions like could I have two types of cheese on my burger. He was clearly frustrated and the other two guest I was with were not impressed either. He didn't smile say hello nothing. This message is to Corporate, I will be posting this to my Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter letting all my friends and family know not to come here. I am a restaurant manager and I would never allow an employee to be represent my company as such. There definitely needs to be a better screening process as far as who you hire. Lastly he got all of our orders wrong. I did not ask for a refund I was so upset I just left the food there. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE.
author: Tunechi J.

description: I like to order their truffle mushroom burger with smash fries. I would prefer crispier fries, my past orders were semi soft. Their patty is juicy and bread is buttery soft.
author: Kristen T.

description:
Used the online ordering thru yelp and my food was ready to go when I got there.  So far, awesome experience.  

But then I get home and the burger has none of the adjustments I requested.  I paid extra for avocado...not there, i checked the box online for no mustard and no pickles...got tons of mustard and pickles, and of course the cheese was wrong too.

Cmon guys.  I want my money back.
author: Bryan F.

description:
I went here for lunch at the invitation of a friend.
I had a simple Smashburger Classic and a strawberry milkshake.
The burger was good, but not as good as the burgers at Super Duper.
But the milkshake was wonderful - thick and creamy.  Their shakes are made with Haagen-Daz ice cream and that makes a big difference.
The service was fast and efficient.
I would return if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Philip C.

description:
Friendly service, clean and inviting atmosphere. Not to mention a pretty dam good burger and fried pickles pretty good too. The burger was juicy, the bun was fresh, the onions and tomatoes were fresh too. 
I know my burgers and I got the basic Smash burger with cheddar instead of American cheese. Sometimes a basic burger cooked perfectly with good meat and all fresh ingredients is all you need. 
What pushed me to 4 stars is that they have fresh jalapeños not pickled. 
In my opinion any place that uses pickeled jalapeños is just lazy. The fact that they put the extra effort on getting fresh jalapeños, transitions to the extra effort on good meat and fresh toppings. 
Along with that a perfectly cooked burger that is still DRIPPING TO THE VERY LAST BITE.
author: Greg H.

description:
I am not opposed to giving this place a second try. However, my first experience was not very satisfying. 

If I do find myself in a position to return, I will order the "Big" burger size (6 oz), rather than the "regular" as my 4 oz regular burger was a little too smashed. It was the Bay burger, and tasted ok. They definitely cook the meat through. On the other burgers we ordered, this wasn't an issue. On my overly smashed burger it was sort of a detriment.

Service was ok. None of the staff were rude, but there was no pleasure in their attitude. We came during a small lunch rush on a weekday and waited for a good ten minutes. They could use more cooking staff, but don't look like they have enough space for more.

The fries were decent and crispy. The Smash Fries didn't seem well tossed and had a lot of oil on them. The garlic, oil and seasoning just seemed to stick to the inside of the box.

I'm just not sold on it yet. I do like the specialty burgers in a fast food setting, but I would prefer Five Guys. Five Guys may not have the salads, chicken, cheeses and other great options that Smash Burger has, but they get the burger and service right. These two seem the best to compare.
author: Todd W.

description:
Two burgers, two soft drinks and a regular fries comes to $20. A bit pricey for fast-food, but I've had good experiences here in the past.

I ordered a "big" burger that was actually a regular. The fries seemed pretty sad, almost wilted. My girlfriend's Windy City burger's pretzel bun didn't have any salt on it and her burger didn't have any pickles on the side, even though we explicitly asked for it to come with them on the side. The burger is supposed to come stacked with shoe-string onions, in reality it came with just a few. Depressingly few.

Disappointed because this place has been decent in the past. Now it's just a mediocre, over-priced alternative to McDonalds.
author: Sam H.

description:
On par with McDonalds but 10x more expensive.

I wasn't expecting to be blown away, but did certainly hope for better. I ordered a classic burger which I thought would be a safe choice. After two bites I threw the rest away. Gross.
author: Brandon S.

description:
The "To Go" salad I bought tonight was, well, repulsive.  Yuck.  

Do not get their Cobb Salad.  I should have read it in more detail, that would have helped.  It's a fried egg, not chopped hard boiled egg.  The onions were over-powering, I was given no dressing (found this out when I got home).  The grilled chicken was plain and in a slab (chopped into bite sized would have helped).  I guess in my mind I though Char-Grilled not just tossed on a hamburger grill. The chicken was very Plain and "why bother".

Tossed out the whole bowl of yuck.  $7.99 into the trash.

My friend DID like their burger.  2 starts for that I suppose.
author: Karen L.

description:
Had the Chicken sandwich with truffle mushroom and swiss. Not a burger but it was a content sandwich to help me drive over the bridge.  The sweet potato fries were good. Even my dog loved it the next day.   

I will have to come back for another tasting to eat a burger, for what they are known for.
author: Marck N.

description: It's alright, not much options for vegans. Even their black bean burger patty has cheeses and butter. Fries and salads for the animal friendlies. For the black bean burger it's overwhelmingly 'beany'. Service is okay considering it isn't dining. Fountain are available for refills.
author: Harry G.

description: Came here to finish off a great day in the city and Tom made it so much better. Great service and food.
author: Alexander B.

description: Smashburger is awesome! From the food to manager, the manager is a gentleman that knows how to keep his customers happy, such a friendly person even in middle of lunch traffic, definitely recommend this place! Burgers, fries, onion rings are great. Haven't had s chance to try milkshakes yet, hopefully next time
author: Ben T.

description:
Food is good, but glasses and tables were greasy.  I was using one of their plastic red glasses and the edges had greasy fingerprints.  Additionally the table top was dirty.  

I have eaten here several times, but a dirty eating environment is a huge turnoff.
author: Coyote B.

description: Not bad. The smashed burger is an interesting concept. I ordered the classic burger with goat cheese. I like that you can customize your burger. I also got an oreo milk shake which was heavenly! They bring it out to your table when its ready. Prompt service and pretty good food.
author: Cynthia T.

description: The burgers are ok, nothing special. Can't have your burger cooked to order. The shakes are good. Hall of flame burgers are much better
author: anthony j.

description:
I like this place very much. 
Consistently solid food and service.  
Service is very nice and attentive, the stuff people are very happy to be there.. Probably not, but they look like they are. That what I want to see when I go some place. 
I always order Bay Burger $7.39/large ciabatta bun, mushrooms, arugula, truffle mayo. Not the best burger, but very good for the price and fast food place. It's juicy, beefy, mushroomy, truffly. Smash fries are crisp and delicious. All condiments are free. Truffle  mayo is my favorite. 
Food comes out fast. 
Clean place and bathroom is clean.
author: Natasha S.

description:
best fast food chain burger in my opinion - the potato bun, the meat, the veggies are all fresh and top quality at every location I've been to - so the food is not the problem 

the problem is with this branch - how in the world does it take 35-40 minutes to place an order and get 1 chicken bay burger? not the place to be if you're in a rush or hungry.

maybe I went during an off day but it wasn't even prime lunch time - 1:30/2pm? wasn't too bad of a line - maybe 7ppl? but somehow it took 15-20min to just place an order then another 20 mins for the order to be ready.... smash and dash? more like smash and die waiting.

the one plus - it's in a shopping plaza so there's plenty of parking
author: Brenda L.

description:
This is the best fast food restaurant I have ever dined at!  I love the burgers, the fries and the salads are amazing.
I eat at "Smash" at least twice a week.  Parking is easy!

Congrats to my friend Tom and his friendly staff.
author: Billy Raye V.

description:
This seemed like a cool new place to check out for an early dinner on a Friday night so I took my girlfriend on by. We're in the middle of a move and just needed a quick bite before hitting the road.

The manager was nice, but SUPER excited that we'd stopped by. She took five minutes to explain the concept, the menu and drinks before we were allowed to place our order. A black bean burger (there is no such thing as a black bean burger, I contend, but we'll talk about that another time), sweet potato fries and I had a bacon cheese. Simple.

Long story short, what I got was a mediocre cheese less burger and a sleepless night. I won't got into detail why sleep evaded me, but I strongly recommend volunteering to sleep on the couch if your sleep partner decides to eat the black bean burger (its not a burger).
author: Sam P.

description: These burgers, along with their fries and shakes are just so awesome! They're the best in history and on the entire planet! I really suggest you go here sometimes because it's really a blast! I also really love how they have a limited edition birthday cake shake accoridng to the image on Yelp.com, and that makes me want to go there near or on my birthday one day! I would rate this to be 100 times better than both Mcdonald's and Burger King combined! I know it might be only 7 years old now and pretty young, being founded in 2009, but it still rules! I suggest that on the weekends you try going here for lunch one day on a gorgeous day out!
author: Asher D.

description: Not the best burger I had but I like the portion, the price, and their garlic sweet potato fries are delicious! The line goes out the door so arrive early. Once you order, the food will be brought to you. There is a code to the bathroom so don't embarrass yourself lol. I would not return for the smash burger but will go again to try something else.
author: Lisa N.

description: Really dissatisfied with this joint. The Smash Burger I tried in San Diego (La Jolla) was really good and was expecting the same. The quality of the food and the staff don't even come close. One time I came after work and I had to wait 30min for my order because they were under-staffed. The burgers ended up being charred too! Every other time I ate there I had bad stomach pains for the rest of the day. I've now lost complete faith in Smash Burger and will not be coming back.
author: Sergie M.

description: They're good -quite good.  The burgers, the chicken sandwiches ... we especially love the "vegetable fries" and the easy to customize menu.  The service, though, can be very very slow ... also, Smashburger has a very convenient pick up counter, but order way ahead and pick up at the time it says, because even if you send the order in right away (even if they have no customers0 it won't come through to the cooking staff until a few minutes before the seemingly randomly assigned time.  So don't do this option if you're in a hurry - better to walk in and order.
author: Alexandre P.

description:
At the high end of the fast food business, their burgers are fine but have a lot of bugs to work out in their management process. 

They encourage you to order online, so I did. My order was supposed to be ready at 1 o'clock but it was 15 minutes late. During the time I waited, I saw more than half of the orders that came out of the kitchen go back for rework, making for lots of frustrated and unhappy customers. 

They gave away lots of apologies and coupons for discounts on the next visit. I probably won't be using mine.
author: Rick S.

description:
After hearing since buzz about this place opening up in the Potrero Center, I finally decided to stop on by. The inside looks very contemporary and well kept. Not to bright inside and really clean.

I went with the burger with the bacon and bbq sauce (can't remember the name) and my girlfriend decided to get the same, but with chicken. We also got an order of Smash Fries because who can resist all those nice seasonings. Food didn't take too long to arrive and we went straight to work on those two burgers.

The meat itself was really outstanding. I wasn't expecting it to be as flavorful, but I was presently surprised. The bacon added nothing to my burger in my opinion, but the bbq sauce was a nice touch. The chicken counterpart was also nice except the chicken was a bit dry. In their defense, the chicken had to be pounded pretty flat.

The fries weren't that great. The fry itself was too thin for me and the taste was decent at first, but it wasn't a fry I can enjoy for more than 5 minutes.

Overall, I would definitively come back for another round of burgers, but I think I'll just stick to burgers.
author: George Z.

description:
I've been to 3 different locations on 4 separate occasions, and the service has been wrong 3 out of 4 times. 
1st time, Mill Valley: I asked for chicken, I got a burger. I still ate it, and it was delicious. 
2nd time, Emeryville: my friends and I went on New Years Day and I guess only 3 people showed up to work that day, so we had wrong orders and orders that took half an hour. Again, food was incredible, so it was hard to be mad. 
3rd time, SF, 15th St. shopping center: spot on. 
4th time, SF again: my cashier was a bit abrupt with me, and gave me grilled chicken instead of the crispy I asked for. I still ate it, and it was delicious. 
I'm worried about the workers. I hope they're being treated well. 
All in all, the food is SPECTACULAR and worth eating, but upper management needs to make sure their workers are okay.
author: Nora M.

description: the cashier was very friendly, the food was ok, not great but the burger fell apart after the first bite and was much smaller than the picture suggests.  the garlic fries were good.  for fast food, it took a while to prepare.
author: Hiki L.

description: I ordered the spicy jalapeno and avocado burger with jack cheese... it was superb to the erb!!! I wasn't that hungry to begin with but this delightful, layered, hand-held angel was sent from heaven and I couldn't resist but chomp it up in minutes. I definitely will come back and try their side dishes and plethora of burger selections!
author: Chantal P.

description: The burger was good....but those Smashburger fries....oh my! Made with rosemary and other herbs...better, YES BETTER than garlic fries! And I love that they're shoestring fries. I'll go there if only for those!
author: Martha H.

description:
Sometimes free isn't really free.  Like when you get a free (as in you paid no money for it) Truffle Mushroom Swiss Burger for lunch, but then you wind up having to "pay" for it the next day by going to the gym or worse, starving yourself the next day to make up for the fact that you just unknowingly consumed EIGHT-HUNDRED dang calories for a regular sized burger.  If you include the order of fries, then add another 150-200 calories.

Was the burger good, you ask?  Heck yeah!  Probably the best tasting burger, I've ever eaten, although very unassuming and plain in appearance.  It was so flavorful and aromatic.  You're hit with the garlic first, then you get punched with the cheese and the mushrooms...  Nice and soft, fluffy bread...  And, then, the truffle mayo???  That's the knock-out punch right there.  From that point, you're done.

But, regardless of the enormous pleasure I received from the aforementioned Truffle Mushroom Swiss burger, I must blame Smashburger for My Fitness Pal being mad at me.  You see, My Fitness Pal and I haven't been friends for very long so we're still working out some trust issues.  Apparently, I can't  prove convincingly enough that it was not my intention to eat over 2/3 of my daily calorie allotment in one meal.  

So, you'll understand, SmashBurger, if I won't be able to see you for a while?   My Fitness Pal will have a 'hissy'...
author: Danielle O.

description:
I know what you're thinking...What's up with the name right? Well, SmashBurger's signature patty is "smashed" so that it gets crispy edges on the grill and it's cooked to medium. Because of this, the patties are not super thick and it makes sense once you try it!

My favorite was the classic Smash Burger on a fluffy egg bun with a side of Smash Fries seasoned with rosemary and garlic. The crispy haystack onions are super tasty too! Honestly, there are so many burger combos to be had -- and that's not even including the "secret menu" that includes things like fried pickles and fried eggs for your burger! 

And they serve beer (typically partnering with local breweries, which is awesome) + Haagen Daz milkshakes. Overall, this is a solid burger joint with fresh ingredients and reasonable prices.

BTW, if you don't notice the signage right away, it's probably because SmashBurger's logo looks remarkably similar to GameStop. It's hiding in plain sight in the shopping plaza!
author: Jenny N.

description: They have the best burgers but they have the worst fries and worst onion rings. The fries they sell are so skinny, I can't even taste the flavor. It completely sucks because I love the burgers they make but so far I have not been able to find any size that I can order to pair with the hamburger. A real shame, only 4 sides are available and only the sweet potatoes are fine.
author: Julia G.

description:
Meh.  Tried this place 5 times over the last few months and 3 times things went wrong.

Today, takeout order  of 4 burgers, sides and shakes.  18 minutes elapsed from the time the first burger hit the sack until the last.  So that first burger was cold and stale.  The onion rings were of course soggy because they sat there so long.  The shakes sat out for 10 minutes before they were put in a freezer while we waited for the food, but they were still melted.  One of the shakes wasn't the right flavor, and one of the burgers had incorrect toppings.

One a previous visit, with 2 burgers, one was lost somehow after being made.  They score half a point because they offered to remake both.

And on another previous visit, items were not made to the order.

The food is pretty good, but considering the time this location has been open, you would think the kitchen would be onto the game.
author: Michael G.

description:
First off, I didn't try their burger.

I just stopped by for a snack of fries and a shake, and had the spicy buffalo fries or whatever they're called, and a nutter butter shake. Both were disastrous.

The fries are shoestring, but are cooked as if normal cut, hence they're overcooked and crispy. If you like them this way great, I don't.

The shake was watery, not much creaminess, and the nutter butters added precious little flavor. The ground cookie bits were also very soggy, far too soggy for the cookie to have been added fresh, so I wondered whether they're using nutter butter ice cream. I doubt it, so the soggy cookie is not easily explainable, unless nutter butter get much soggier than Oreos very quickly.

If the goes-withs are this bad, I can only imagine the food, so I won't bother trying it. They go on and on about Certified Angus Beef, but at the end of the day this is just a brand that doesn't tell you anything other than the ranchers are part of a large coalition that uses a common logo to promote their product, much like how BBB or Diamond Certified works.

And the music is WAY too loud.
It's a cheap joint for a snack, not a discotheque.
author: Rob C.

description:
Great burger joint. The burger patties are "smashed" and still super juicy. My favorite is anything with truffle on it.

Their fries and onion rings are also very good as well.

Haven't gone wrong here yet.
author: Teese N.

description:
Costs about the same as BurgerMeister or even The Counter but overall value and quality are about 60% as good - more like what might be a good experience at a Carls Junior than a step above the mass market and their pink slime meat.

On the plus side - a nice facility, clean and with good parking i.e. Potero Center. But hardly second-visit material due to incredibly average burger quality/value. 

Staff ~ok, average at best.
author: Steve L.

description:
as far as a burger food chain goes, i am a fan of smash burger!

i tried the truffle mayo burger and i was pretty surprised just how truffle-ly it was. its was pretty greasy but i was in the mood for a nice greasy burger :D 

the rosemary garlic fries were good as well, greasy as well but not in a super heavy and gross way

id definitely choose this place over MCD/burger king so ill be back the next time i want a tasty burger without paying $10+ for a "gourmet" burger
author: Katherine C.

description:
I see the word 'smash' and naughty things come to mind (I know...what else is new, Christy!?). Seems like an appropriate word to associate with these burgers...I eat a smash burger, and I feel so naughty!  Just like the Hulk, I want to SMASH!

In the world of keeping up with the latest and greatest burger trends, Smash Burger has somehow managed to fill a niche. It's your everyday burger concept...but *SMASH* a bit different.

For a chain joint, their burgers are darn excellent. I like them much better than Five Guys...but they just can't beat the price-point of In N Out.

Lot's of excellent burger combos to try...I'm rather partial to the truffle mushroom swiss myself. You can choose one of their options off the menu, or you can go crazy and create your own with one of their many excellent toppings.

Be sure to try the Smash fries...I love the rosemary and olive oil combo!
author: Christy L.

description: This place is probably one of the best burger places I've been to. So I went in the dead of night around 9, I was waiting for a concert. And I went inside and order by making my own order. What really kind of sucked was the employees. The manager ended up firing a guy right in front of my mother and I. Not sure of the whole story and to be honest I could care less. But personally I thought it was a bit unprofessional to do so in front of a few other customers besides my mother and I. But once we got in the car with our order, we began to demolish every last bite of our burgers. All in all, great burgers, awkward services.
author: Sheryl L.

description: This place is yummy! I always have their chicken sandwiches and they don't disappoint. The only issue I have is that the serving size is a bit on the small side and the serving of avocado is tiny.
author: Diane M.

description: Smashburger was good but not great. The service was good, the food was good and the place was neat. I didn't expect anything, therefore I got a few different things for my family and myself. The burger was good, the chicken sandwich was good, the fries are good and the salad was good. No frills, just good food which I appreciated. Also, it's great they open at 10am for those of us who have lunch early on certain days!
author: Janet P.

description: I decided to come back, although fearful, I was presently surprised to find that it was under new management. It no longer took 40 minutes to get a burger. No longer did it become busy during the lunch rush. I wasn't ignored by the staff. Tom, the new GM, is a very professional and friendly man who keeps his staff on task and keeps customers happy. Honestly, I think he deserves a raise. He has turned this establishment around. Thank you Tom for giving me another irresistible option come lunch time!
author: James H.

description: Tom the general manager is a wonderful man. He was really impressive and insightful about the place. He took our online order and was really sharp. Our burger was piping hot when it came out and the fries were sizzling. I ordered Bbq Bacon Cheeseburger with smashed fries my mom ordered the truffle burger and my dad ordered the big surf burger. Their burger is much better than In n Out and Five Guys. If they went nationwide, I think SmashBurger could give the other two fast food franchises as well as McDonald's and Burger King a run for their money. I wish Tom and the other folks at SmashBurger the best of luck in business. They have a lot of potential of dominating the burger and fries market. Their burger is at the top of my list of best burgers to eat. I am looking forward to having their CEO being featured on CNBC one of these days.
author: Danny W.

description:
Who doesn't love a good burger?The hubby and I both ordered the Truffle, Portabello mushroom, and swiss burger w/ a side of the smashfries. I think, the fries are tossed in olive oil, garlic, and parsley? We were both delighted with our food. Oh and their ketchup packets are hella cute. I should have took a pic of it, but I was starving...lol.

I personally think the food is over priced. But then again, I think everything is. I usually never go out to eat. We spent 18 dollars for 2 burgers and 2  fries. For $18, I could have bought 9lbs of ground pork @ pacific super, or bought 4lbs of ground turkey for 3 nights worth of dinner. I dunno, call me frugal, call me cheap, call me budget betty...I don't care...lol. We are a family of 7, so my mind is always thinking of a deal. LOL. 

The establishment is nice and bright. We didn't eat in, we ordered everything to go. 

Anywhere in SF with FREE parking always gets 2 thumbs up from me

Anyways, if you haven't tried Smashburger, do yourself a favor and go for it! :)
author: E C.

description: If you're interested in enjoying a delicious, freshly made burger or salad; this the spot! Business has definitely picked up here.   Not surprised!
author: J F.

description:
New burger joint chain has finally made it to San Francisco.  This location is in the 16th and Potrero center.  Modern, clean interior. Known for using 100% angus beef that is cooked on a hot buttered grill to sear in the flavor and juciness.

Classic smash ($5.29) American cheese, SMASH sauce, ketchup, lettuce, tomato, pickles and onion on an egg bun was a company and messy burger.  Good beef flavor and juciness.  Not exactly big, probably should have ordered the bigger one.

Create your own burger ($5.29) Cheddar cheese, Ciabatta bun had a good quality bun along with the signature moist beef. Another high quality solid burger we would rank far above In-and-Out.

Smashfries ($2.29) Tossed with Rosemary, olive oil and garlic were thinly sliced fries cooked almost artisanal style.  Nice and crispy.

Vanilla Shake ($4.49) uses Haagen-Dazs ice cream for a pretty rich, tall shake. Almost as expensive as the burger! This also took a while to make.


Overall - Very Good
Food - Very Good
Decor - Very Good
Service - Fair
Value - Very Good
author: Ellen H.

description:
If you don't want to spend a little extra on quality and a little bit of "gourmet," then don't come to SmashBurger and complain about the price. Go to In N Out, or even McDonald's across the street. But for those who enjoy eating a hearty, mean, fresh burger then SmashBurger is your place. I like their variety of toppings and different types of burgers you can customize, plus their "Smash sauce" which is free.

SmashBurger is always consistent, friendly and clean - and even better, open until 10PM. I always order the classic and it definitely hits the spot. I love their fries as well - it adds a very gourmet touch with the rosemary, olive oil and garlic. The fries are delicious - thin, crispy and piping hot! I'm going to be a little wild next time and add an egg and bacon to my beloved classic burger.
author: Jamie Y.

description: Terrible... Missed my order so i have to wait for 35mins just for the order. And the workers were arguing... Definitely first and last.
author: Simon L.

description:
It's been a little over two years now (July 2015) and probably over a year since my last visit, and I have to admit it:  I prefer Smash Burger to In N Out.  The fries at the latter don't even compete;  In N Out's fries are a disgrace.  It's the burger.  The meat at Smash Burger is simply the best flavored of any I can think of---better than any of the burgers I've had at some rather posh places (and at posh prices) where I'd prefer not to see burgers, and even some out of state efforts, at chains practicing on a similar level of quality, like Cascade.

Even more annoying than the ridiculous spread of the burger among restaurants (not to mention mac-n-cheese; flank steak; and fish tacos) is the fact that almost all of them, even with purportedly fine quality beef of the most contented bovines, have so little flavor;  the beef itself isn't particularly exciting, and the seasonings seem timid.

Having found the beef so delicious, it's only reassuring to find the fries are just as good.   I can't say they're the best, but they are very very good, and consistently so.  There have been a couple of places where I went bonkers over the fries on the first visit, only to have the second visit provide what appeared to be twice cooked scraps.

And they serve beer and wine.   

If I happen to go to In N Out more often (which isn't very often at all----say once or twice a year tops, vs once---maybe twice a year to Smash Burger;) it's because I'm more likely to head towards the water, towards Irish Coffees, than I am to head to a part of town that is, let's be honest, butt ugly, and with nothing else to recommend it, once you've taken the trouble to get there.

So, when I'm in the Legendary Burger Joint, I'm not only denouncing the fries, I'm eating the burger and thinking "Nice, but not a Smash Burger".  When I'm out of town, I'll be looking for Smash Burgers.  I'm a loyal person, but when someone else does a better job, you have to reward them, not just hang on to what was...
author: Paul T.

description:
3.5+ stars for this place.  I'm glad I was referred to it by my coworkers.  It's a great place to come for burgers for those of us who like variety as to toppings (like being able to choose a bacon burger with BBQ sauce) but at the same time don't want to go to either a fast food place or a "gourmet" burgers with serving typically greater than a quarter pound and leaving me feeling overstuffed afterwards.  Some people say the burger may be small for the price, but I think it's the perfect size.

The rosemary garlic fries are somewhat unique and quite a treat also.
author: H K.

description:
The proximity of this place from my gym makes it a perfect lazy-post-workout protein palace.

The food is surprisingly good! Everything is freshly prepared. My go-to is the Baja Cobb salad with chicken. Their sweet potato fries are pretty dang good, too. You can also order your burger bun-less if you're trying to stay semi-healthy (at a burger place, of course), but aren't in a salad mood.

The customer service here is really friendly, too. I'm just bummed they don't have fried pickles at this location (probably for the best, considering I come here AFTER my workouts).
author: Sabrina V.

description:
The Spicy Baja Burger has a nice kick to it, the Avocado Club burger is nice and fresh, fries are nice and crispy. The burger meat itself is very juicy and delicious. Ordering a burger "big" sized is a good value, you get a lot more meat for only a dollar extra. The only thing I would change, the Oreo Shake was a little runny, but still very tasty.

The staff is very friendly and quick! Overall, it's not going to blow your mind, but is definitely a solid place to get food that will leave you happy. My girlfriend and I will definite be regulars!

Overall price: $23 (not bad for two burgers, fries, soda and a shake in SF)
author: Phil M.

description: The staff is very friendly and the food is definitely good quality. I ordered the bbq bacon chicken burger whtg smash fries. They call it smashburger because the meat is smashed on the grill and comes out wider.   Got good chicken as well as beef.
author: Dan G.

description: Food was okay. I would never come back to this location. Restaurant was filthy. Also, employees talking to one another cussing and also play wrestling each other where one of them was screaming. This location needs help on managing and customer service.
author: Ammie C.

description: Wow, never had a smash burger until today and it was smashingly tasty! I ordered the truffle burger, big size with grilled onions added at no charge and haystack fried onions. My bf got the bay burger big size. They had a BOGO promo that ends 9/24 so we got 2 burgers and a size of fries for only $10!!! What a steal! Not only was the burger delicious, the customer service was way above and beyond. As soon as we walked in we were greeted with a smile. Cashier recommended the sides. They also bring out your order to your table and in a timely manner. They ask how the food was, they ask if they can refill your drink or if they can get you anything else and they offer to remove the basket as soon as you are done eating so it's not in your way. I've never experienced such high customer service at a burger joint before. The only con I have is when you order the big size for my burger it means the patty is bigger while the bun remains the same size. As a result it was very messy to eat because the patty kept falling out of the bun, but they have forks and knives and plenty of napkins. My bf had a ciabatta bun which is a bigger square bun, I'd highly recommend that bun if you are gonna up your size. Mmm can't wait to try their other selections.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
Great service and even better food 
I ordered regular bay burger and man did it deliver! The truffle mayo really shined through.  Honestly a little sad that it's gone. Can't wait to go back for lunch. Nice clean location was a plus plus!!
author: Raquel F.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by Smashmouth!  The burgers were juicy and the Smash fries are pretty awesome!  The manager came around to every table and said hello/checked on us which I thought was a really cool thing.  The restaurant seating area is spacious and they have a clean bathroom.   This is a great little lunch or dinner spot when you want a fast good burger option. Hint: Get the bigger burger option.  The regular us just a little undersized for me.
author: Brian S.

description:
Check your burgers before you leave 
They may mess up your order
author: Kevin S.

description: I come here often because it's near my job and really love the Cobb salad. One day my card wasn't working and the manager tom recognized me and comped my meal, which I truly appreciated. I will continue to come back, for the service, location and food
author: Lorain C.

description:
This was a-fucking-mazing!! I came in hungover as shit, ordered the BBQ bacon burger, and an Oreo milkshake.

Service was friendly, food came quick, price is super reasonable.

The burger was hot and juicy, and I tasted some type of high quality organic grass fed flavor in there, but I'm not sure if it came from the beef or the bacon. I don't know if it was organic, or free range, but it tasted the type of meats that I get when I go to whole foods.

The burger didn't come with fries, so I was kicking myself for not ordering either their truffle fries or sweet potato fries. Guess I'll have to come back!

The milkshake was a great milkshake, and they gave me the little metal cup so you pour more.

I'm definitely gonna get fat on this place.
author: Phil G.

description: Giving Super Duper a run for their money. Luv the bay option of arugula. Reminds me of chain Shake Shack back east. Took a whole group of burger lovers from work to lunch to raves  -- roomy and not too busy (does need more central location).
author: Fred O.

description:
Okay, the truth is I don't eat burgers very often and if I do I go to Burger Meister or Barneys...Gourmet Burger.  However, I was damn hungry and the Potrero Center is my 'hood place" for many things;  Radio Shack, Petco, Safeway, Starbucks & Peets, Nubi, Office Depot, etc 

So there I was, and as I said, I was hungry...........................
I'd been noticing it from the outside for weeks so I figured I should check it out. 
I only got a burger so that's all I can write about.  I got pickles on the side and no mayo.  I changed bread to ciabatta and the cheese to swiss.  I ordered the bacon, cheese regular burger with mustard, tomato, raw red onions and lettuce.......$5.99 + tax.  This was not a gourmet burger, but I thought it was damn tasty and I will definitely go back again for my 4 burger limit a year!  Convenient location, clean place, very nice staff, really reasonable prices and a good, good burger made with Angus beef, generous portion of Applewood Bacon and cheese of your choice.
author: Patrice C.

description:
Really happy to have this additional lunch option near our office! 
First day there today and I had the basic burger and fries - will try more exotic options, chicken sandwiches, and salads on future visits.
The burger was perfectly serviceable. It's of the wide and thin variety, which means it gets cooked through fully. Fine if you like yours medium/well, but if (like me) you look for a thicker patty cooked to a juicy medium, with pink in the middle, then you'll be disappointed. Fries were fine, a bit on the thin side for me but nice and crispy.
Overall, a much better alternative to the McDonalds next door, but not quite in the Super Duper league that they're priced for.
author: Andrew R.

description: Another burger chain that feels like a burger chain. Sadly, their burgers are totally not worth the cost. My gf and I had the bay chicken sandwich and avocado club smash burger. The burger, while decently seasoned and cooked, didn't make me feel like I was eating a comprehensive dish. All the components felt awkwardly smashed together (see what I did there?). The bay chicken was fine, a little salty, but mostly, it was just too small. There was nothing on there! Only like 5 pieces of arugula and mushroom. So disappointing. For 5 bucks apiece, heartily disappointing.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
a solid choice for a burger if you are in the area

the truffle fries were drenched in way too much truffle oil though
author: Long C.

description:
Smashing success.

For your ears: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tETirzcSVlQ

For your appetite: Outstanding homemade black bean burger on a multigrain bun.

Build your own for $6 which includes free toppings like grilled onions. Balance out your healthy choice with a little of their mayo and mustard based smash sauce. It's good.

Five stars for Tritonal smashes and Smashburger.
author: Jason B.

description: My first visit...The food was great...prompt and friendly staff and they serve real cold beer! I had the avocado chicken w/ rosemary fries just delicious!
author: Sandra P.

description: I first tried Smashburger in Fort Bliss, located in El Paso Texas. I haven't seen many around but all there food is really good. What I really like is there chicken burgers. If your have never heard or gone to this restaurant I would recommend you give them a try. I think you will be pleasantly surprised.
author: Luis L.

description: The NASTIEST vegetarian "burger" I've ever had --seriously bad.  I ordered the TRUFFLE MUSHROOM SWISS (of the vegetarian variety).  The "meat" was a very dry and crumbled refried beans "patty" or the like, smashed between two very dry pieces of bun with a slice of swiss cheese and a few slices of soggy fried mushrooms.  Normally, I DON'T EAT ANY OF THIS type of crappy "fried to oblivion" fast food (uh hem, they call it "fresh"), but I was participating in an all day meeting and someone volunteered to go out and pickup lunch for the entire group. They also have pretty nasty fries too that were room temperature and covered with deep fried soggy parsley flakes when delivered (worksite is a two minute drive from restaurant).   EVERYTHING WAS soggy and deep fried to oblivion. NASTY.
author: Paul In S. F.

description:
No point going here for lunch just yet,
Line out the door,
1 person on register moving very slowly,
Inquired about a 2nd register opening up ?
Blank stare and a maybe tomorrow from the manager,
Place looks good !
If you see a line at all just walk. 
Jb.
author: Jeromhia B.

description: Laquisha was really nice until they had a rush... Very very very unprofessional staff. Laquisha was yelling for help at the other girl to help ring as no one assisted her....then the general manager Mark appeared to assist after several customers walked out... First time here... Very interesting
author: Patrick M.

description: FUCK this place. Thanks for putting one cashier on during lunch. Smart move manager, you fucking dolt.
author: J. B.

description:
Okay, so SmashBurger was pretty awesome when I went there-- lots of seating and a pretty awesome menu. I actually didn't order anything, but I had some of my friend's fries-- the smash fries are AWESOME. They have a great taste from the fry itself with a tint of rosemary--not too much and not too little.
Also, I tried a bite of the burger, (bacon cheeseburger) and it was GREAT. I wished so badly I wasn't full so that I could order my own burger...

Back in NYC now and I'm tempted to make the trek out to Brooklyn to go to the SmashBurger here!

PS: I heard their shakes are awesome!!!
author: Azinda M.

description: This place is kind of like a less greasy version of Super Duper. The fries leave something more to be desired though: they're too thin and so you have to eat a lot of them to get that same level of satisfaction from large steak fries.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Let me clarify something first.. When I order my food the front end assistant  manager was really nice and the rest of the crew... "when I ordered my burger."The whole place looks absolutely clean and it has tons of place to seat.. That got the the 3 stars..  
The burger it self got 0..
1- They advertise it is  grilled and it isn't not grilled.. I owned  a grill before.. I know what it should looks like and taste.
2-when I grabbed my burger to eat, the fat was dripping like "a raining day in San Francisco in January.. " I'm aware that burger is damn fatty, but I had to use 15 napkins to keep the grease of my hands. All the other fast foods restaurant that I've eaten in the past wasn't grease at all..
3-I asked for the classic smashed burger to come plain. No maio, no cheese, no special dressing, no bacon. And it still dripping all that oil?
