4-immerse your own consciously awareness 
yourself by eating the" classic burger" I don't deliberately your calories worries, but I'd definitely want u to be in touch with healthiness of the burger.. It can be done healthier .. Specially when they promoted it  grilled.. Surface cooking isn't the same as griled.. 
5- I'll give it  one more try..
author: Pedro D.

description: To bad Daniel wouldn't let me place a phone order, would of saved me a lot of time. This is my second time ordering from the 16th street location. Nice staff, just wish I could place a phone order.
author: Debbiedeb W.

description:
Don't understand what the big deal is about this place it is an overpriced crappy McDonalds...... That being said came here recently as I work in the area and saw the raving yelp reviews..... Was very disappointed the burger had a weird gamey taste to it and was cooked extra well done the fries and onion strings where the saltiest thing I've ever had.

My friend and I shared two different burgers, the first was the bay burger which was not the business meat was very dry and the arugula and the mushrooms all had a weird taste to it. The only decent thing I had here was the bacon burger it at least tasted half way decent.  

I gave two stars one for the friendly staff the other for the great Ice Tea LOL........


****** Don't be fooled by the raving yelp reviews********
author: Michael W.

description: A decent burger. A lot to take in on the menu for a first-timer. We had the classic smashburger and a Windy City smashburger and smashfries. Liked the fries a lot, rosemary, olive oil, garlic not too overwhelming. You'll have a good meal here. We compared it to Roam burger and would go to Roam instead, but would definitely have a Smashburger in a pinch.
author: Carol E.

description:
I was shopping in the area and coinsidently i ended up in this place. I did not have much time so i took my order to go. By the way space is very big i thing it was a former blockbuster spot.
Interior was cool, clean and servers were helpful. I tried regular size bay burger with arugula and it was suprisingly tasty. 

So yeah, if you are in the area and need a quick hunger fix definitely you should check it out.
author: Lyra S.

description:
I read about this chain opening here in SF and as a result, my husband and I have a new favorite burger joint. OMFG, this place is off the chain Super high quality ingredients, decent prices, even the serving dishes which hold whatever free condiment you want that the staff bring to your table are silver. Living here, you almost get used to even casual restaurants being overpriced and precious. Yet, Smashburger is the exception.
 Great burgers on cibatta buns, truffle mayo (oh yes) arugulla, fresh haystack onions, applewood smoked bacon, matchstick fries with rosemary and garlic, shakes made with Haagendass ice cream. Most toppings are complimentary! Even a meatless burger freshly made with black beans for when my veggie best friend comes to town. No gimmicks- most burgers are $6-7 for a very rich satisfying experience.
author: Antoinette S.

description: Def a good spot to try again.  The crispy skinny cut fries with the olive oil and rosemary were really good.  The burger was pretty great too and they have a large selection of toppings to choose from.  The only thing is that there was a little miscommunication on the toppings I wanted.  I ended up with more toppings than I asked for.  But I really couldn't complain about that.  It was delicious. You order up at the register then they bring it to your table.  Clean dining room.  Bathrooms pretty decent too.
author: Marisa G.

description:
Pretty surprised by how much I love the food here! Just an FYI, they don't do take out phone orders. But anyways! For starters, I walked in like 15 minutes before closing and the person who had taken my order was still very nice to me! Thumbs up for that because if it were me, I would not have been that nice at last minute customers haha. 

For some reason, I thought the burgers would be small with how they're priced. But I was gladly wrong about that!

I ordered the bay burger with extra onions and sweet potato fries! Have to say that it was delish. I love love love truffle anything! Never heard of truffle mayo before until this place and it went so well with my burger. The sweet potato fries were good as well. Nothing out of the ordinary but nothing bad either. Granted I did order for take out so everything probably would have tasted better if I had eaten there but nonetheless, the food was still good :) 

Overall, I think this place is great. Food's good. The prices are great. Service seems cool. Ambiance and decor were nice (mostly bay decor, what's not to love!) 

Definitely makes me want to come back and try everything else on the menu.
author: Jackie N.

description:
I actually really enjoyed this place! My boyfriend and I debated on going here or to Umami Burger and ultimately decided coming here because it was about half the price. It was very inexpensive but had great quality food. I had the Chicken Avacado Club while my boyfriend had the Spicy Baja burger and we both couldnt get enough of them.
We totally coming back here soon. Oh, and they have a parking lot which i find to be very helpful in San Francisco.

If you sign up for their Smash Club online you will recieve some coupons!
author: Rebecca T.

description:
BEST BURGER I'VE HAD IN A LOOOONG TIME! The Truffle mushroom swiss, yum! Also, great service, thanks Trina and everyone else! 

I will be going back again and again.
author: erika e.

description: Good burger.  Service was professional and the place looked clean.  About what you'd expect.
author: Scott N.

description:
This place...

When we first started coming here maybe 6 months ago, it was quite good for a fast-food place. Great vegetarian options. But, over the last 6 months they genuinely seem like they are trying to fuck up. The man and I often order the Spinach, Cucumber and Goat Cheese salad. I cannot honestly remember the last time that it was correctly made - either they forget the goat cheese, or the pumpkin/sesame seeds, or it's drowning in dressing. The french fries or the "Veggie Frites" (deep fried sticks of carrots and green beans) are COVERED in grease, to the point of needing to wipe them off before eating. Their fries are good, but somewhere the process is falling apart - lots of other fast food restaurants seem to understand how to make french fries. I'm really not a picky person, but every time we come here we ask ourselves why we did it AGAIN.

When the food is made correctly, it's good - just know you're going to have to ask them to fix whatever you order.
author: Patty N.

description: I've never been here before . I thank you. Burger was great. People were friendly. And the place was clean.
author: Darren V.

description:
This place is a good addition to this part of the city. SB fits in well as an upscale chain place, in the context of a mostly corporate strip mall. 

I'm not a burger guy per se, but they also have a really good chicken sandwich. Everything is good and fresh. There are a number of ways to customize your sandwich. I tried wife's burger, and while I'm no fan of beef, it did seem to be well put together. The salads are inviting. There are three options for fries, all done properly as well. 

The one fairly small thing I'm not fond of is the lack of a good iced tea. The machine there produces a weak, flavorless tea, like the mix has not been prepared properly. A couple of times I've noted this to the staff, and they say they'll have someone look into it. I just ask for water now after a few tries over a couple of months.
author: Roger B.

description: Well the spicy wasn't spicy,  but I heard they do not use frozen food, and was wondering how is it possible.  But yes,  it is possible and one could easily make the difference. Very delicious n soft meat.
author: Dev D.

description:
This place isn't half bad. It's better than just about any fast food burger, except In-N-Out. It's definitely better that Five Guys, but then what isn't?

There is certainly a 'concept' going on here. Look at the CEO and the corporate leads, mostly marketing and branding guys. But the food is fresh, not too expensive, it comes out fast, and they have Cherry Coke on tap.
author: Matt J.

description: Been here a couple of times and service is not on point, they need to step it up and do better. Yesterday was here with my husband and I was  not pleased  with my order fries were extremely grease  and my burger was just slope, ice matching dint have ice and they were slow. Not a happy customer.
author: Maria O.

description: I Love this place!! I had it in Downtown LA by the Staple Center and was so happy when I found it in SF. I wish they would put one closer to my house. Their food is fresh, healthier than normal fast food. Matter of fact, I wouldn't consider this place a typical fast food joint because of the quality and prices. I don't eat MacDonald's and all that other crap, but I will eat a grilled chicken classic Smash from here on a wheat bun. delicious!! Their service is great too. Man....now I'm craving their sweet potato fries and all I did was write this review...lol.
author: Jasmin D.

description: 23 minutes wait between ordering ( two burgers & fries for $20 ) and being served and then I got cold regular fries instead of the smash fries I ordered. The kitchen crew at this location is not yet up to the demands of their jobs.
author: Robert D.

description:
When we walked in, my amazing, gorgeous, and stunning fiance said "its like chipotel... but burger style..."    Shes a very picky and healthy eater, so i didn't tell her where we were going till we got there.e.    Ive been here a few times since they opened with some co workers, but never with her, and wanted to go someplace casual and not so expensive.     

There is a bit of an illusion that this place is very health concision, being it's right next to a vitamin store.    Even though the food is good, and the place is very clean, i didn't think its all that much healthier then any other bacon cheese burger could be.   But the service is fast, the staff is polite and even though the price point is a few bucks more then you'd normally pay for a good burger, you do save on the tip, and they still bring your order to your table.   One big plus was the nice server girl when she brought the food to the table asked if there was anything else we wanted, and she was happy to get us a side of ranch.   Not something you'd expect at a fast food place of this nature.   Pig ups to the staff there.   

The regular fries are nice, cause they are extra skinny, so that makes then very crunchy.   She had the Baja chicken and bacon with fresh avocado ... it was very tasty.    Of course I ate all her bacon.   I had a very juicy bacon cheeseburger with onion crisps on it.   It was delicious.   the buns are yellow and very yummy!     Despite the bit of excess grease, the bread stayed together very well.   That's always a good thing.    

Parking is convenient, but in the worst corner of that mall... so watch out backing out... all those nutty people that go to Ross don't drive so well.     I'll likely go back, cause the place is extra clean, and the staff is very nice, and the food is good.   $24 for 2 people for lunch with 2 burgers, drinks and sides at a decently healthy place for fast food is a very fair deal considering the convenience of the parking.    I would give it 5 stars... but its just a glorified fast food joint.
author: Vlad C.

description: I did the online ordering at the website for a reason....to not have to wait for my food. I ordered two salads and two shakes. My order took 15 minutes longer than it should have taken. Thanks for wasting my time SmashBurger.
author: Brooke A.

description: I love Smashburger especially because of the great experience I've had for their branches in the south bay, but of the two instances i've been at this branch, they've consistently managed to screw up my order: Spinach-Cucumber-Goat Cheese burger. the first was missing the cucumbers and the second(tonight), was missing the goat cheese. I will be visiting this facility a third time, hopefully they won't screw up my simple order!
author: Roland T.

description:
About what you'd expect. Edible, sort-of tasty burger (had the mushroom truffle) but you know you're not off to a good start when the cashier says, "They [cooks] only make it one way: with a little pink or well done."
The soda machine was busted, the dining hall floors were sticky, most of tables weren't clean (despite the few customers)  and the bathroom appeared to be coated in urine (this last one may be due to its 16th and Potrero location). 
Won't be back.
author: D C.

description: One of my volleyball players recommended this place after one of our games in the city. Since it was close by we all went. I've never been here before but I have to say it was pretty darn good. Had the bacon cheeseburger and regular fries. Better than average burger. Pretty darn close to shake shack in New York. Real ground meat makes a great burger and this is one of those places.  Loved it. So did the volleyball team.
author: George S.

description: Process is great, but burgers are a bit greasy.
author: AJ K.

description: As advertised ...I ordered a smashburger and got a smashed burger
author: Carlos G.

description: Try the Cobb salad with crispy chicken.  Delicious, appropriately priced, quick service.  Everything I could ask for.
author: Adam H.

description: I had the Avocado Chicken Club.! Super delicious chicken sandwich with a lot of flavor.! And the Chocolate Oreo shake was a thumbs up too.! Definitely will go there on my lunch break again.!
author: Jackie W.

description: Vegetarian black bean burger contains eggs and cheese. Heard rumor that all sides are cooked in beef fat. Too bad. Good service and food if you're a carnivore.
author: Christy H.

description: I went here once before and thought it was ok, but last night we came here for dinner and my sandwich came out with raw chicken (I am 8 months pregnant and I was so starving I didn't notice until I'd already eaten half). It took forever for a remake, and I was so hungry but it still wasn't very good. Obviously it's a health hazard for a pregnant woman to eat here since salmonella and listeria are harmful to an unborn baby, not to mention disgusting to eat raw chicken!!! On our way out I had to hold on to my husband because I nearly slipped (but caught myself thank God) on their greasy floor. The fries and fried pickles were extra greasy and not exciting. I'd say it's on par with McDonalds. Eat at your own risk!
author: Lauren M.

description: Good stuff!  I encourage you to customize your own burger.  First understand all the various ingredients (ask about the local ones) and be creative!  Ask about the Bay Burger!  Try it with the egg bun!
author: Paul John G.

description: a little pricey but hey its san Francisco... anyway I get a double blue cheese bacon burger. its a decent burger for lunch I wouldn't come here for dinner I wouldn't be satisfied for having it for my last meal of the day yea I know im weird. the employees are helpful and nice I had no problems with them. the patties were watery (the only way I can explain it haha) and tasteless some people may call it juicy but I call it watery there's a difference. it could of used some salt. the fries are smash mouth haha regular fries or the smash mouth fries are good small and crunchy. I never had a shake there but they look good. I recommend it if u want a burger and in the area it will satisfy your need its not a bad burger I come here once in a while.
author: Rigoberto C.

description: Just had a smooshy but tasty bean burger and side salad. One of the staff eagerly took away my plate as I was eating the last bite. All set? he said with one hand on the plate. Kind of weird, but whatever. Tasty tasty food. I recommend reading the menu online first.
author: C S.

description: Everything was okay, but generally just disappointing.  Laying down $10+ for a burger, you just expect it to be better than Wendy's.  The bun and all of the toppings were first rate, but the burger itself was super spongy, watery, and bland.  It just tasted like a Sysco frozen patty cooked without even salt added.
author: Josh Z.

description:
This place is great!  The service is terrific, and I like their menu.  You can have a great cheeseburger, or you can fancify it by having one of their truffle mushroom burgers or the jalapenos Baja burger.

Great food!  Good prices, and the people are terrific.  It's also really clean! (I love that!)
author: Douglas S.

description: Best "fast food" burger around; handily beats out In and Out with options, Jack in the Box with quality and McDonalds because it isn't. Fries are on par with 4-star restaurant appetizer versions of the same.
author: Chris B.

description:
I have been here many times now. I do have to say that their salads are my favorite. Burgers are good as well as the chicken burger. I do prefer the grilled chicken over the fried because you can taste the marinade. I do love sweet potato fries but did find theirs lacking. The smash fries are just okay with to much rosemary for my taste. Their regular fries are wonderful. You can change or substitute as you wish, sometimes at a slight cost. They have a good variety and are very reasonable. 

Time wise, it usually takes longer to order than it does to get your food. We usually have our food within 10 minutes or if they are busy 15.
author: michelle b.

description: Really wanted to like this place, but after today I will not return. i ordered a regular burger with chipotle mayo......first strike, rude waitress takes my order as if I annoyed her by asking how ordering works as this is my first time. Strike two.....no mayo to be seen on my burger once it arrives......strike three.....A HAIR ( light brown ) on my sweet potato fries!!!! I showed my mom and she could not believe it and she eats here often. GROSS. Sorry but I personally want my food minus random hair clearly not mine. No manager was in sight to complain to, so i just left my food. What a waste of money and above all time.
author: Christina M.

description: Love this place! The burgers are great, as are the smash fries, and the milkshakes.  I come here atlesst once a week.  It's that good
author: Roman R.

description:
Enjoy delicious, plentiful semi-fast food. It is like fast food because you are literally in a mini-mall parking lot so you feel like you are in the suburbs of San Francisco, the service is fast and the layout is fast food. It is not really fast food because it is not as cheap but also far more tasty. 

They have beer! And great milkshakes! Go there now!
author: Ojus P.

description: a very nice change for the "healthy lunch" options that are all over the SF FiDi.  When you are craving a nice juicy greasy burger, this place is solid, and great staff.  Ask for some mushrooms on your sandwich and get ready for a long nap in the office.
author: Mike S.

description: Their chicken falls out of the bun it is so big!  Their ingredients have always been fresh when I have been, and their staff is always friendly.  Long lines if you go at lunch during the week, but well worth it.
author: Stacey D.

description: Not a great burger. Not sure why this place is so highly rated. Beef was overcooked, bland, and greasy. Also the patty is way bigger than the bun which makes it slip out and then you just have a big mess. Sweet potato fries were crispy but over salted. Staff was very friendly though. Super duper is much better for a similar price point.
author: Sarah J.

description: I had a veggie burger which was very soft and not so good tasting.  My friend had a hamburger which was uncooked and totally pink.  So we could not eat it anymore and decide to leave.  As a curtesy to other customers I go to tell them that the burger was uncooked so that they look at their quality control process. Then they tell me that is their style and if I wanted it cooked all the way I have ask for it when ordering. Seriously!   Will never go back there.
author: David D.

description: I wasn't quite craving beef, so I ordered the Baja Chicken Burger.  I was a bit afraid that the chicken might be dry but to my surprise, it was super moist and tender.  The burger had a good kick to it with the jalapenos but wasn't too spicy.  Their smash fries are so addictive, skinny fries with olive oil and rosemary, YUM!  Their oreo shake was good too.  I can't wait to go back and try their other burgers and nutter butter shake.
author: Veronica N.

description: smash it. great food. unique menu compared to regular burger shops.
author: Kumar G.

description: I usually come here for lunch if I'm craving a burger. Last time I was here, I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and it was pretty good. I decided to give the smashfries a try & it was delicious ! The portion of the food they serve is good, considering that it's pretty cheap. The strawberry shake never disappoints me either.
author: Sara L.

description:
One of the best burger I had from a chain restaurant.

The meat is as good as at Five Guys but it is juicier so the burger has a bit more taste.

The bun could be a bit crispier and it would be an excellent burger.

The fries are thin and crispy which is the complete opposite of Five Guys where they are fat and soggy. I like both type so that's easy but you might not.

It is not in the best part of the city so don't expect a nice atmosphere and area.

Wished they had some TVs also to make it more friendly and make you want to stay longer and come back more often.

It is very cheap though for such a good quality burger so will definitely go back when in need of a burger since there is no Five Guys in SF.
author: K L.

description: A decent burger place. Nothing out of the ordinary. Just a good place  with good food. Clean and new.  My son loved it though! Will come back.
author: Jorydude r.

description: Always happy with the service.   Fast.  Excellent.   Yummy.  Having the jalapeño burger!
author: David R.

description: Good food good service. I'm always in and out. The staff are great people. They have best customer service in the mission
author: Alonzo T.

description: It was quite nice. Tried a burger with bacon and avocado.  It was good. Tasty. Not too greasy.  Will not rush back or be opposed to it.
author: Stephen C.

description: There's something about this place! These burgers are some of the best I've had, they're not too big in size but they're delicious, the hot fries are good as well, if you love burgers I guarantee you will love this place!
author: Carlos F.

description:
I love a good burger, and was excited to read a piece in the Chronicle about this "gourmet" burger chain opening in Potrero Center.

I was a little put off by the signage posted at the winding, cafeteria-like line to the ordering counter listing rules for how to order. Their website and ads portrayed them as a gourmet sit-dowm burger joint. But all appearances told me I had entered a cafeteria. 

When I got to the cashier I ordered their BBQ bacon burger, medium rare.  The cashier paused a moment, then said "We only serve burgers well done".  I said "What?".  It took a moment to believe that a "gourmet" burger joint refused to cook their burger to the customer's preferred temperature.  But, sadly, it IS true.
I haven't eaten a hamburger cooked past medium since I was 12, and certainly have no intention of doing so now because this fast food chain doesn't care to train it's cooks well enough (or pay them enough) to do so.
I left.
There are plenty of SF places to get a great burger.  Smash Burger is not one of them.
The Super Duper burger local minichain serves an excellent organic burger here in SF (also smashed and crusty on a homemade bun), and will gladly have their better trained and paid cooks prepare it to the temperature you request. At a lower price. So save your hard earned money while satisfying your gourmet burger jones there. 
Smashburger is just McDonald's disguised low pay no service product model with more PR attitude designed to fool the consumer.  That might succeed in other markets but I hope it's not good enough to succeed here.  We like to think we have better expectations here, but we have to vote with our dollars if that rejection of corporate chains is to be a deterrent.
Are you in?
author: Gary N.

description: Normally the service is excellent.  The burgers are very good. However it's apparent there's been a turnover in staff. It literally took 10 minutes for a customer order to be taken. I  was the third person in line to order.  I requested to see the Manger? I was informed she was on break.  The cashier asked me why what's up I responded the level of service ,the time it's taking to place an or  and proceeded to leave as I turned away the young lay wearing a name tag identified as Jay began to laugh as mocking me. I felt it was very insulting, disrespectful and devalued as a customer.  As a business in the retail industry extremely unprofessional and quite ghetto! !! Perhaps Smash Burgers need Smashed the the whole entire crew for their misconduct. Even the cook found this amusing.
author: Deborah K.

description:
Don't understand where the ratings are coming from... maybe because it's new and neighborhood people are just excited because they have an alternative to the McDonald across the street.  ..  But I had a momentary lapse in suburgatory and when to a chain burger joint....
Avocado Club Burger: Fresh avocado, applewood-smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, ranch dressing and mayo on a multi-grain bun. 
First off, putting and mixing in crazy ideas on classic standards is usually an open door for failure; and if  your going to go there, you better be top notch with it and your ingredients.    
While the burger patty itself was pretty good...  The toppings were beyond unacceptable.  The tomato was so unripened it was white, and the avocado was a unsliced quarter of the fruit just plopped on top of the open faced bun.  It was so hard it could not simply be "smashed" in and both were tasteless.  
If I'm happen to be clear across town while craving a burger again I may give them a another chance to prove themselves but right now I don't get it.  I don't see them surviving outside of strip malls or in the city of some damn good burger joints.
author: John W.

description: Continued proof that nobody in SF actually makes a good hamburger. A very poor experience at SmashBurger. When the coke is the best part of your meal, you know something is seriously wrong. The burger was disappointing, thrown together as if it were made by a third grader, greasy and tasteless. The fries were way over salted and thin, microscopic thin. Then the service, one person taking orders at noon. Instead of taking care of customers and moving them along, she found it more important to flirt with the guy in front of her. Neither would win any beauty contests. Overall a poor experience, would never go back.
author: Henry J.

description: Seriously good tasting burger with an egg bun!! Can't believe the quality in this chains food! This is one of my all time favourites and we drove across the bridge to eat this one tonight!!
author: Prima D.

description: For fast food, very fresh and very good. Glad this place is in my neighborhood and don't want it to go away. The truffle mushroom Swiss is a good burger/chicken option.
author: Scott H.

description: Been here 4 times. First three with mushroom burger and side salad were excellent. Last time bacon cheeseburger I found the food so salty that it was hard to finish. Service is friendly and excellent. Salads are fresh   good budget option for burgers. Much better than usual well advertised chain stores
author: Lambchop B.

description: This place is a winner. Delicious burger and fries at a reasonable price. Sit at the counter and talk to your buddy. I'll be back guys - keep up the good work.
author: Matthew C.

description:
My son and I were on our way to Togo's to have lunch between jobs when I saw this eatery. Let me start by saying that I NEVER order a burger when we go out, I typically do not like burgers. 

I asked a couple of people in line if they had been there before and it seemed like everyone in front of us was there for the first time. 

I ordered a large buter (I was hungry and for $1 more, seemed logical) with grilled onions, chipotle bun, and chipotle sauce. My son ordered a jalepeno burger and we shared an order of smashed fries.  My burger was perfect in every way, I was pleasantly pleased. I didn't care for the fries however. I love garlic fries but this had hints of this and hints of that, not quite enough of anything to make it outstanding. My son pulled all the sliced raw jalepenos out.

The first time we were asked if everything was ok, I was impressed. The second time we were approached by a different worker, I said "wow, what service". ok, enough already, we were there about 1/2 an hour and by the 10th time, I was beyond annoyed. There's good customer service and then there's irritation. This was the part that took a star away.

I got home & did the online survey and conveyed this very annoying point. I went back a second time with my husband and other son and the burger was still good. Consistency is a good thing. This time we didn't once get asked by anyone if everything was ok. Being that it is not a table service place, I actually don't mind. There were enough employees roaming around that I could've waved someone down if I needed something. 

I think it was the same employee that took my order at the cash register. He was not too bright but his friendliness made up for it and they got our orders right both times.
author: May G.

description: If you like burgers and fries then this is the place. Not as expensive as the other HOT burger joints and just as impressive. I even heard the secret sauce they use has tears of angel or something like that. I am not sure since it is a "secret". Anyways, get the burger with bacon and cheese (or if you are a snob, its called a bacon cheese burger) because you will die. Yes because its good but because its also packed with high saturated fat and salt. Remember that no one lives forever so live with style (and ditch your girly Prius). See you there.
author: Edson C.

description: This is a good, tasty, burger joint. If you haven't figured it out already, the meat patty is "smashed" and flattened. I wonder why they do that...it's good nonetheless. I have gotten the cheeseburger and the club burger (I wouldn't recommend that one).  We have tried both the regular and smash fries, I prefer the regular fries because the smash fries are a little too oily for my preference. The best part of the meal is the Hagan Daaz milkshake!!!!! I love Hagan Daaz ice cream and having it in milkshake form is heaven. Can't go wrong with any of the flavors.  I'd come here solely for the milkshakes.
author: Kristina N.

description:
The Order:
Spicy Veggie Black Bean Burger
Smash Fries
Soft Drink

The Total:
$11.17 Didn't see any option to Tip

The Food:
I was expecting to be served up a Boca Black Bean Patty like most restaurants which try to include a Vegetarian option, but this one appeared to be made in house. It was a bit dry and unflavorful, would have preferred a Boca in this case. The teaspoon of guacamole did nothing to satisfy my insatiable appetite for all things guac.

Smash Fries tasted great, though were on the greasy side.

Service:
Incredibly Fast and Incredibly Friendly

Would I go back;
The only option for this Pescatarian failed to meet expectations, I make a meaner Black Bean burger at home. May visit if i'm in the area to try out the shakes.
author: Derek I.

description: PB& J shake, sweet potato fries & classic smash!
author: Lacey M.

description: The Spicy Baja burger was great!  Regular size with extra jalapenos was just perfect amount of hot, juicy beef, great bun.  The employees are super friendly and made sure I enjoyed my meal.  They also keep the place spotless, cleaning tables and chairs immediately.
author: Shawn H.

description:
The Bad:
Some people only eat burgers medium or rare, so just know that at SmashBurger they ONLY cook them well done. 

Some people want table service and for the same price as Mcdonalds...this is not a place for table service. 

If you order as I did without reading the menu, you may get a burger without garnish, now I'm sure that is somewhere on the menu, but when a person walks in for the first time and there is no wait and tell them it's your first time, that should be explained. That's because the menu behind the counter is for 2020 vision and not everyone has 2020 or wears glasses or contacts. But from reading another review I see it was mentioned that there are laminated menus just left of the door when you walk in, but who looks there? As you walk in you're looking at the counter and that's where you would go.

The large burger kind of hangs over the small bun (not a bad for me cuz I don't need a lot of bread).   

So that is the bad as I see it all wrapped up.


The Good:
The burgers ARE juicy, just not medium or rare. They will make the burger to your specifications, but only well done. 

The burger that I had came with truffles, mushrooms and swiss and was highly seasoned which I like (that may be a bad to some people who hate salt). There is a choice of regular or large size, I had the large. 

The SmashFries are seasoned in Rosemary and dipped in an oil, which I forgot which oil, but they are delicious. (If you don't like oil, then you should know not to get these).

The Excellent:
The service was better than I have experienced in most restaurants at any price. The staff was nice and seemed very friendly. I was asked 3 times how everything was and did I need anything else which may have been a little overkill, but understandable for a new place. I'm sure this will not be the case after the top staff completes the training of the locals and move on. By that I means that there probably won't be an over abundance of staff around, if they are going to make a profit.

Overall:
If you're looking for the "dream burger joint" this ain't it. But it beats Mickey DD's, BK and Jack in the Crack anyday.  It's clean, friendly and tasty.
author: Jim L.

description: The food is good. Tip: Be Very specific about what you want on your burger. If you don't tell them you want lettuce then they won't put it. The service is horrendous. Food sits ready for a while or in my case until you ask for it.
author: Khara T.

description: This place is pretty good! I ordered their Classic Grilled Chicken Burger (with fried egg, of course) and regular fries - both were really good! You can also order online, which was really convenient. I'll definitely make this one of my regular spots for lunch!
author: Freckles H.

description: Pretty good burger, but the buns are a little too mushy for me, the fries are just ok, and the place has had glacial service the few times we've been there.
author: Michael S.

description: I had the chicken and avocado burger and it was really good. Fries are a bit too skinny though, imho.
author: Kira G.

description: Burgers don't get any better than this! Juicy and full of flavor.  Yes, they are pricey, but you just can't beat the taste.
author: Alyson F.

description: YUMMY!!!! Tried the bay and truffle chicken burger and OMG the truffle burger is BOMB.COM!! I drool thinking about it.
author: Fiona T.

description: A really good burger. Of course lots of crust, but also seasoned well and that egg bun was fluffy welcoming. I love how you can get a beer as well. Kinda cutty location but worth a visit or three!
author: Anthony R.

description: I had Bacon/Chz Big Smash $7, Fries $2 and 22oz drink $2. Burger looked juicy from the outside, a little dry in the middle. Maybe they smashed it a little too much? The cheese made it taste kind of gooey good and bad, depending if you like it. Fries had a very slight hint of rosemary, hot and fresh but average. Overall not that impressed for $12 out the door.
author: Doggy W.

description: Got take-out this past Sunday. Classic burger and sweet potato fries were so good! The burger was a little heavy on the onion but I just took it out. Will be coming back.
author: Graciela C.

description: Wanted to see what all the hype was about this place........wow this place really lived up to all the hype... Ordered the truffle burger.... One of the best burgers that I've had came out hot and tasted really fresh... Ordered the haystack onions a little on the greasy side still very good. The staff here were awesome and very attentive.. What a find will be back really soon
author: George E.

description: Tried Smash again, during their lunch rush.  Again, a solid, tasty burger.  Still only 3 stars as the shake maker wore gloves inconsistently.  Additionally, my partner and I ordered the same burger, the BBQ, Bacon and Chedder Stackhouse.  Inconsistent quality.  His burger had a mound of stackhouse onions, while mine looked as if they'd given me his leftovers.
author: Dwayne R.

description: Pretty good, burger was a little greasy, dudes that work there are attentive and try hard to turn over orders fast, probably will come back we'll see.
author: Trevor M.

description: They were good when they opened up - up the first few months, then the quality went downhill thereafter.  Even the salads, had too many dried leaves, not fresh at all and I know I won't serve that to any guests I have, let alone ask them to pay pricey for it?  Waste of $$$$.  No longer recommended.  BTW, why do they allow dogs inside where people eat?  that's unsanitary.  I asked the Mgr and he said, so long as the dog handler says its a guide dog, its ok.  But the stupid dog was a freaking chiwawa... for crying out loud.  These Mgr is so stupid, the dog outsmarted him obviously.  He can't see straight.  Fire him now.
author: Jaime L.

description: There are few burgers that actually impress me. My favorite gourmet burger is The Counter, seconded by Umami. My favorite fast food-ish burger was 5 guys seconded by in and out but I think this just became my new first. Fresh tasting like In n out but better fries and a bunch of toppings like 5 guys but not as greasy! Great work and the people were nice there!
author: Adrian A.

description: Great burger for the price, not at all greasy, and the best customer service. The staff were constantly waiting on us offering their services
author: Max Z.

description: Had SmashBurger for the first time and it was great!!! Had the Truffle Mayo, Swiss, Mushroom Chicken sandwich and now I'm addicted!!! Fries and veggies were really good as well...Bella and Danielle were very sweet and professional. I was surprised how clean the restaurant (even the restroom) was which is a HUGE plus in my book!!!! Overall an enjoyable experience and I will definitely go back!!!
author: Noree B.

description: Very clean establishment, friendly service, clean bathrooms. The Burger is the right size for my big appetite and the vanilla shake is made with real Haggen das ice cream. Plenty of parking, great location. . A++
author: Robert L.

description: Had the Cobb salad. .. liked the fried egg on it. Didn't try the burgers but I will be back at some point I'm sure. Lots of parking here which is nice.
author: Jeremy R.

description: So I ordered for pick up at around 5:30 today. I picked up on time as instructed.  The place was nice and clean. The staff was great, but the food was just not good, the quality of the food is what I would expect at a baseball game. This review lies solely on the chef.
author: Captain Muffin D.

description: These are the best burgers for the price ever. The service was good also, it didn't hurt that the girl at the register was really cute too. So, all in all SB you get the 5 star review! Good Work.
author: Richard C.

description: nice friendly spot... pleasantly surprised by the laid back atmosphere, fast service & excellent food.. I immediately liked the place when I walked in and the instructions were #1 grab a menu #2 control your excitement #3 place your order.. being a bit on the vegetarian side i had the Ranch Avocado Black Bean burger with Haystack Onions.. very yummy .. usually veggie burgers are tasteless & disgusting .. but this one had great flavor.. the multi grain bun was warm & toasted.. the toppings were fresh & the avocado slices made it perfect except for occasionally sliding out but the messier the better in my book... :P  & on a side note.. i usually try to eat half & take the other half home when eating out.. but for the first time in a long time i ate the whole thing.. the whole damned thing..  but i regret nothing:)
author: Patricia A.

description: Putting this up for fellow Keto-ers.  In addition to several salad options, you can get yourself a very Keto-friendly bunless burger here with leaf lettuce suitable enough to pick the burger up so you don't have to knife & fork it.  You can add a fried egg, bacon, and guacamole or avocado slices (extra charge, but totally worth it).  Psyched to have another Keto option around town.
author: Andrew H.

description:
More like 3.75 stars, but it's good considering it's a chain.

Plus, their online ordering option makes it convenient for me to get lunch for other people in the office.
author: Brian M.

description: Came in with my sisters to just try the place and i must say its a pretty darn cool place . Nice enviornment and clean . The Staff was very friendly . Got our order as about 5 minutes after we sat down . The burgers we had , Beat Mcdonalds . The Price wasnt too bad either . Definitely will be returning !
author: Moanna S.

description: I hate to say it but I like this place.  The first time I came here I had a chicken sandwich and it wasn't so great. I wasn't sure what the fuss was all about. The next time I followed up with a burger. Now I see why.   To me at this price level,  it's five guys and smash burger, the edge goes to smash burger. French fries are good although very thin.   The burger was excellent.    Only things missing were more bacon and lower prices.  This place wasn't too crowded.    Everything else was par for the course.
author: Bob R.

description: Really tasty burger.  for being a well done burger, it still is juicy. Fries are a little on the skinny side which is a bummer cause they are so yummy. They also have a "secret menu" which my boyfriend loves. Most of the employees are kind as can be with a few looking like they dont care.  I hope this place stays as nice as it currently is.
author: Bree C.

description: for a chain, this place isn't so bad. expect laminated menus and a single dollop of perfectly placed whipped cream sitting atop your milkshakes. the burgers are decent and the smash fries (rosemary and olive oil) are tasty. i wouldn't ever purposely make my way there but if you're hungry and are already in the super suburban shopping center then go ahead and stick with the suburban theme; eat at the chain. nobody will judge you.....i think...
author: Regina C.

description:
Had lunch there yesterday 9/26 great avocado chicken club.  Loved the atmosphere, servers great.  We had Bella help us she did great.  Thumbs up to cooks.  I work close and have now found the spot.  Recommended to co workers and they were there today.  Welcome to the neighborhood Smash Burger we needed you.  
Will be back next week
author: Shelley B.

description: This place is fast becoming my favorite lunch spot.  The staff are very courteous, friendly and well trained.  Everything is made to order and tastes, quality...definitely a cut above fast food.  It is hard to make an argument to not have lunch here when they ate close by to my office!
author: Jason C.

description: Food is decent but not worth the expensive price. Service was shitty. Cashier looked like she got too lit before coming in and was now coming down and irritable. Service was probably the worst part actually. Won't be coming back.
author: Aidan M.

description: My daughter , 4 y.o. granddaughter and I really enjoyed our lunch :-) we shared a classic Burger and garlic fries , I had the peanut butter and chocolate My daughter had the root beer float.... the staff are super friendly and so is the environment.... o yes and its also pocket friendly , lol...
author: Christine P.

description: Hip happening place for a Great Burger.  Mark the new GM is doing a great job!
author: Timothy E.

description:
this is the nastiest damn burger i ever tasted.
fries are nasty as hell any other fast food in and out who i dont care for burger king, etc beats them by far. didnt do my burger the way i asked. 
now I know about fries because I love patatoes period .
I know good french fries,, hash browns etc.
SHITTY
SHITTY SHITTY AT SMASH BURGERS.

WHAT IS SUPPOSED TO BE SO SMASH ABOUT IT CAN U TELL ME PLEASEEEE! 
SOMEONE.

dry as hell
dont look anything like the pictures posted
everything was just nasty. 
my first time too.
wowwwwwwww!
i didnt think a burger could look and taste so bad, but they out did they self .
nasty
nasty
nasty
terrible!!!
not even 1 star if u ask me
honestly tasted like s h i t!!! 
close this place please??
do me a favor 

illlllllllll!!!

I told my girl if she ever mention the word smash burgers again, and waste my money  somebody gone get slaped for real.
Thats how nasty the shit is.
author: G W.

description: eww this place isn't too friendly...my fries are cold and the help has their food and drinks in view for me to watch their heavyset bodies eat...very unflattering and unsanitary plus the soda machine is down yet they are restocking the cups and lids...why no one is using them!!
author: T. L.

description: The burger was OK. I like that they use fresh ground beef. The fries were so-so. I might have enjoyed it all better if I didn't have such an awkward interaction with the general manager Tom. First of all, it's weird that they keep the men's room unlocked and the women's room locked. When I asked for the code he asked "for the mens or womens?" which I didn't mind because I am fully aware I look like a boy. I answered, "either one works." He responded "you can't go in the women's if you're a man" pretty loudly. My first reaction was to laugh and brush it off my shoulder. But when I came back and he handed me my food there was no apology, nothin. I asked why just the womens room was locked, and he explained that he was trying to prevent harrassment of women. I told him I didn't care what he said but someone else probably would have, the way he put attention on me the way he did. Then he got awkward, started cleaning the tables next to me and mumbling to himself how he doesn't judge anybody, and that he was "blessed" to mind his business. Then for the rest of my meal he just kinda stood around looking at his cell phone. I feel kinda sorry for him. I mean, this is San Francisco. He really must not get out much.
author: AJ C.

description: First time here and wasn't the greatest experience... Not the friendliest people in there. Fries were old but they replaced them quickly. The burger was ok tho.
author: Angel C.

description: I ordered pick up and had arrived a few minutes early. I opted for the mushroom truffle burger, I was really looking forward to a tasty burger but mine came out warm and it was literally smashed like some one sat on my burger, it was pretty pathetic. Sweet potato fries were warm too, would not come back again. Should have paid a few more dollars and stick to what was familiar.
author: vu p.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE absolutely! My boyfriend and I always love to come here for their Juicy Burgers. I love their Vegetarian Spicy Jalapeño Black Bean Burger! IT is soo spicy with the sauces they combine inside! He always gets their original Smashburger We always get their Smashfries as well it so good with the garlic flavors!! Great for something fast but a little bit upsale from Fast Food, it is a great place to sit for lunch after working and the employees are very nice they ask if you want to refill drinks etc. VERY great place to Eat at!
author: Sophia W.

description: After In and Out Burger, probably the best tasting fast food chain in the in San Francisco.  The quality of the staff can be a bit choppy, some are attentive others are lackadaisical.
author: Byron W.

description:
$8 for a small burger they call large,so price is a bit high,$2 for frys,and $2 for soda
the burger they call big was kind of small,
the outside of burger was a bit burnt ,and they flatten it out to look wider,you could hardly see the meat it was so thin,the bun and sauce were nice,ordering was fast
but servers had trouble finding your number they give you as its hard to read
they should make them white,it looks like a small place from the outside door but its big inside,20 minute wait for burger so slow service, meat was burnt on outside
friendly enough staff
author: cc c.

description: Great burgers and grilled chicken; fries are out of this world. Staff is friendly. Had the spicy Baja jalapeño grilled chicken. Marinated chicken breast would have been good just by itself but was absolutely delicious with the addition of jalapenos Wauka Moley and a chipotle sauce. My wife had the kids menu burger which was juicy and delicious and came with the best fries I have had since king diner closed several years ago! The next time we went Michelle had the deep-fried breaded chicken breast which was good but not as good as the marinated grilled chicken breast. I had the blue cheese burger which also comes with Frank's red hot sauce on it. Again the burger was juicy and delicious and the toppings really added to the enjoyment. If you can go during their off hours later in the evening for a absolutely fantastic dining experience!  Service was also very quick.
author: Jeff G.

description: I was pleasantly surprised how much I liked this "chain" burger place. The bay burger, I guess it's a CA specialty was pretty good. Also the veggie burger patty was quite amazing. Spicy and bean-y. And I didn't fall into a food coma after eating there, which is a good indication. I would be back again.
author: CatsPjs Z.

description: this is another dangerous spot after super duper , in n out , its tops cafe , five guys etc ... this one is up there too, the egg bun is ridiculous , meat is juicy  everthing is fresh about the burger, the service and the way the crew was running things is something to look up for, amazingly smooth and quiet service , they sure know what they were doing , the place is so clean and welcoming, we also tried the baja chicken so you can go a little healthier if you want .
author: NAEL K.

description: The spicy jalapeno Baja burger with chipotle sauce was totally hot and awesome! Plus Cholula hot sauce on request. The smash Fries with Rosemary and garlic were excellent. But the haystack onions were hella greasy. We needed several napkins to soak up the excess oil. Good flavor but very oily yet super crispy.
author: sky s.

description: Friendly staff, excellent burgers. Similar to 5  guys, but with many more options. Nice to have this option in the city. Tons of parking.
author: John S.

description: Smash was great, I ordered a classic smash with sweet potato fries, and an Oreo shake.  They were all very good, the place was very clean which is very important for me. Service was great and friendly. I don't have anything bad to say about this place besides maybe the parking situation which at times might me chaotic.
author: Chris T.

description: the black bean burger was amazing & the rosemary fries are to die for
author: Tiffany T.

description: Sure, it's certainly not a 5 star restaurant, however, we (my family and I) were pleasantly surprised.  Granted, the place is new, but it's super clean, the staff was very attentive, and the food was surprisingly good (and inexpensive).
author: Jeff C.
